governour whose wife daughter boemund elder thus setled matter went king ascalon assisted force aegypt infested 〈◊〉 jerusalem utterly routed one battel afterward baldequan petit king damascus ſhould oath becauſe matter fact clear purge himſelf promiſe penance murther holy man though guilty conſcious yet ſeemd great ſpite grudg bore lifetime given ſome occaſion aſſaſſination moreover ſhould title realm pope rome alexander long ſtrugled roman offered would admit city leave whole civil government managery intermeddle onely religious matter would granted ſo retird segna informd engliſh ambaſſadours miracle wrought thomas becket canonizd frederick returning italy monceniſi took seculia treachery demoliſhd took alſo aſti ſurrendered fear laid cloſe siege four month alexandria receivd ſo much loſs sally beſieged grew weary eaſter day roſe went pavia treaty peace italy carried mediation pope venetian willing embrace though favourers emanuel yet receivd horrid affront contrary law nation red hot plate braſs blinded ambaſſadour henry dandalo holding eye mean time almeric king jeruſalem raiſed siege cairo though without hope carrying place bought great ſum money afterward marchd againſt aſcalon forcd quit expedition great want proviſions finding soldier much tired broken great tedious toil war undergone long outlive return died left kingdom son baldwin though labourd dangerous leproſie yet managd government great conſtancy wiſdom alexander thinking enjoy perfect peace made new city alexandria biſhops sea dom 1177 ſoon frederick reenters italy great force put confuſion till milaneſes joint force confederate ſo broke troop frequent onſets one frederick horſe killd narrowly ſcapd life himſelf many thoſe pavia como ſide loſt biſhop pavia alſo becauſe took emperours part pope deprived pall honour bearing croſs frederics great men thought theſe miſchiefs happend em becauſe perſecuted church god openly threatned return country leave wicked warfare except suburb hereof large full merchandize chriſtian soldier plunderd ſoon upon weſtwind nile roſe ſo high proviſions ſpoild began great want neceſſaries eſpecially becauſe soldan encampd far beſet paſſages notwithſtanding siege ſtill puſhd till fifteen month lying taken chriſtians ſackd ſo soldiery wonderfully enrichd ſpoil mean time honorius rome confirmd order dominic upon requeſt anathematizd frederic ii becauſe mother conſtantia dead wont reſtrain within duty came rome without right reaſon laid waſt pope territory theſe difference pope emperour diſcoverd soldan movd take opportunity accordingly raiſes greater army ever thinking chriſtians would ſhew head cardinal john colonna rouſed perſuaſions ſo took arm went meet enemy nile come soldan feignd himſelf afraid cope em putting whereof ecelino raiſes siege mantua march great haſte verona underſtanding could hope recovering padua put death diver torment paduans camp number twelve thouſand time frier minor ſent breſcia preaching perſuaded thoſe citizen recal baniſhd guelphs declare church ſame ſucceſs piacenza cremona obert pallavicino help gibellines taken goverment ſole power againſt ecelino confederate pope legat aſſiſted guelphs march army near gambara defeated great loſs himſelf biſhop breſcia chief guelphiſh faction taken priſoner upon ſurrender breſcia ecelino let go free dom 1249 ſucceſs ecelino made legat apoſtolick fearful increaſe power put upon deſign bringing obert pallavicino ſide effected mean boſo donario noble citizen cremona laying barbarous deteſtable cruelty ecelino wrought upon throw alliance enter league milaneſes mantuans thoſe confederate city much enragd ecelino ſeeing ſo many enemy conſpiring againſt ſo rendezvouſing army caſſano thence ravagd country milan provoking aſſociated city give battel vanquiſhd took priſoner died ſoon soncino wound receivd upon death city lombardy recoverd liberty became obedient son church pope legat procurd paduans freedom aforeſaid make end reliques war drive treviſo put death alberic brother ecelino wife child pope alexander taken theſe tyrannizing lord put end ſo many great confuſions ſet mind upon renewing war aſia reaſon quarrel happend genoeſes venetian pious neceſſary expedition laid aſide chriſtians inhabited ptolemais tyre two opulent wealthy city eſpecially peopled genoeſe piſan venetian merchant ſixty four year engroſsd almoſt trade eaſt weſt theſe merchant ſeveral exchange ſeveral street landingplaces nothing common venetian genoeſes church contention aroſe em monaſtery saba city claimd itſelf alone pope would fain compoſed difference ſent letter willing monaſtery ſhould equal free nation genoeſes notice aforehand pope intended determine caſe favour philip montfort prefect city excluded venetian poſſeſsd themſelves monaſtery fortified venetian hereupon unanimouſly leave city making league manfred king sicily raiſe force againſt genoeſes ſetting upon fleet conſiſting two gallies twenty three great ship port ptolemais burn em following blow ſame time make themſelves maſters monaſtery saba demoliſhd genoeſes rather enragd terrified diſaſter fit another fleet encounter venetian tyre country make himſelf mediator peace welnigh agreed news come venetian ally piſans tyre ptolemais routed genoeſes taking ſinking twenty five ship thereupon victor retreated ptolemais vanquiſhd ſled carrying intereſts gibelline faction perſecuting adverſe party though policy moderate behaviour ſides got command breſcia univerſal conſent citizen modena reggio inſtigated thoſe ferrara bononia fearing leſt pallavicino ſhould overpour laſt revolted pope ſide turnd gibellines city giving good effect florentine baniſhd guelphiſm mean adding great ſtrength faction thus went matter lombardy pope ſtill earneſtly endeavouring peace conſtantinople venetian attempted dethrone palaeologus done friend aſſociates genoeſe gave greater power ſo taken malvaſia eaſily made reſiſtance againſt venetian aboliſh death obſtructed endeavour withſtood greatneſs mind sea time vacant twenty eight day john xxii john twentysecond spaniard born liſbon formerly calld peter made pope biſhop fraſcati though himſelf long life tell every body ſhould live great becauſe every body knew life converſation ſo immodeſt ſo ſottiſh behold betraying folly certain new apartment built palace viterbo fell ſudden found among wood ſtones ſeven day fall receivd sacrament church died eighth month pontificate buried viterbo man ſaid great learning little prudence wrote many tract life eſpecially certain rule relating phyſick counted good phyſician wrote alſo another book called theſaurus pauperum poor treaſure ſet problem imitation ariſtotle ti certain however come ſo many learned men fit buſineſs yet need doubt month ſuſpence reaſon great conteſt among cardinal king sicily senator guard conclave time urgent em chuſe frenchman nicolas aſſoon began reign year 1278 reſolvd reſtrain charles power took lieutenancy tuſcany becauſe ſaid rodulphus took ill would perform promiſe going upon expedition holy land upon term ſince tuſcany reckond belong juriſdiction empire though pope gaind point yet reduced notwithſtanding caeleſtins laſt obeyd would need ſo becauſe underſtood king charles ſame mind thereupon went thither paid ſuch homage caeleſtin became pope ptolomy ſays two hundred thouſand men coronation himſelf ſuppoſe people taken newneſs thing holineſs perſon man eremite ſhould come ſuch honour preferrd heaven ſelf ſo long conteſt elector ſoon enterd upon popedom made twelve cardinal men greateſt integrity two eremite becauſe alter former way living take upon grandeur pope ſo kind acceſſible made ſuit granted ſame thing ſeveral perſons brought onely contempt upon dignity leſſening majeſty pope indeed unfit publick buſineſs reaſon obſcure life led wilderneſs hereupon talkd depoſing eſpecially death latinus cardinal good man whoſe aſſiſtance caeleſtin hitherto made ſhift ſupport himſelf ſo vaſt burthen ſome cardinal inſtant eſpecially benedict cajetan cunning man well skilld civil canon law great favourite pope would remove himſelf pontificate leſt church god ſhould endangerd unskilfulneſs governour began think laying papal office king charles ſo much concernd levity ſuperſtition take good man naples endeavour convert ſuch baſe thought whilſt people cryd place would pope caeleſtin heartily beſeechd holineſs ſo might pope made anſwer would nothing god would thought might good chriſtendom cardinal deſired would leave papacy urgent ſoon could telling danger chriſtendom ignorance miſchiefs befell church would put account doomsday holy ſimple man moved ſaid told em would theyd might lawfully done whereupon order made unanimous conſent pope ſhould liberty depoſe ſolitude keep priſon till dyd grief time ſeventeen month firſt came pontificate ſome ſay caeleſtin ſo famous miracle death frequent diſcourſes council canonization many people worſhipd saint put pope naples upon chriſtmas eve year 1294 man great learning experience lived long publick riſen popedom degree honour though without ſome imputation pride ambition whilſt cardinalprieſt martin mount alſo perſecuted gibellines extreamly whence aroſe quarrel pope gibellines columna alſo maintained party againſt pope anagni thereupon began calumniate traduce general eſpecially two cardinal peter james two famous men ſame family upon death ſeveral pope waſted church treaſure ſpread abroad ſcandalous pamphlet againſt perſon done em injury indeed write ſeveral king prince state concerning boniface arrogance ambition poſſeſſed himſelf papal sea againſt right reaſon cheated caeleſtin put priſon ſome write boniface ſent ſome cunning rogue privately nighttime ſpeak ſtrange tone caeleſtins chamberwall tell poor ſimple man voice heaven muſt lay popedom would ſaved cardinal cited appear becauſe feard boniface ſeverity reſolution wherefore retired nepi family columneſes declared schiſmaticks publick decree benefice dignity eſtates caſtles town taken deprivation boniface afterward reduced form decree appears book called sextus boniface raiſed great many men arm quell beſieged paleſtrina ingariſond one sarra famous man uncle got away thence took plunderd town purſud em zagalora columna whence alſo forced fly long reaſon multitude enemy theſe caſtles likewiſe deſtroyd eſpecially columna native country cardinal got away thence went rieti though sarra ſtaid long time wood antium fear boniface cruelty falling hand certain pirate put oar mean ſufferd great deal miſery though willing endure baniſhment hardſhip manner feel boniface tyranny hated whole race gibellines ti well known ſaid prochetus archbiſhop genoa came laid himſelf foot upon aſhwedneſday whereas prieſt uſes ſay remember man thou art aſhes aſhes ſhalt thou return alterd ſome word ſaid remember man thou art gibellin reſt gibellines aſhes ſhalt thou return threw ſome aſhes eye upon head cuſtom nay deprived archbiſhoprick name gibellines though reſtored afterward underſtood cardinal columna go genoa ſuppoſed done columneſes baniſhd ſort boniface appointed double anniverſary one honour apoſtles evangeliſts another honour thoſe four doctor church gregory auſtin jerome ambroſe likewiſe canonized lewis one king france family son charles second ſome ſay profeſsd order francis whilſt civita vecchia turnd secular canon cathedral alby put regular room requeſt bernard caſtanetus biſhop place alſo put forth ſixth volume code pontificial canon law compiled three learned men according order addition ſome new decree city gubio inſtigation gibellines revolted church ſhort time recoverd denied albertus duke auſtria confirm empire though petitioned ſeveral time james aragon dead robert son charles duke calabria terra otranto gone sicily taken catina brake ſuch war ſudden almoſt italy uproar sicilian favourd aragoneſes got navy together onely conquerd philip robert brother took put priſon whereupon robert left catina returnd italy without accompliſhing deſigns frederick aragon coming spain army sicily onely recover sicily terra otranto tuſcany thoſe genoa burn ſo much hatred againſt inhabitant piſa took leghorn burnt ſunk merchant ship mouth river hinder men piſa ſailing theſe thing carryd italy ſmall detriment country whilſt pope ſate ſtill would interpoſe authority make peace place leſt ſhould think heaven peace mankind ſudden ſuch earthquake never known laſted ſeveral place great many day threw many houſes pope whole court rieti fearing leſt ſhould knockd head fall houſes cauſed little hutt built ſmall plank wide field cloyſter frier preacher kept ſome time though bitter cold weather commotion began upon st andrew day appeared alſo time comet ſign ſome great calamity come boniface ſo many ſuch continud earthquake came himſelf made ſeveral cardinal number archbiſhop toledo richard siena▪ nicolas treviſo maſter order preacher john murro general minor one peter spaniard alſo kept jubilee year 1300 gave full pardon ſins thoſe viſited apoſtles tomb manner preſcribed old teſtament though jew firſt quite another ſentiment affair kept jubilee every fiftieth year wherein debtor releaſed creditor joſephus ſays servant slave challenged freedom whence jubilee import liberty mind body truly ſaid free whoſe ſins forgiven commanded kept every hundredth year reaſon year came ſuch multitude people rome part could hardly ſtir ſtreets though large ſpatious ſo throngd came rome time charles earl valois brother philip france married daughter balwin late emperor conſtantinople got leave boniface fatherinlaw might endeavour recover empire force deprived boniface willing gratifie becauſe intended make uſe aſſiſtance toward ſending army aſia recover interdict could charles valois came thither pope order reſtrain florentine ſo much drive albi white city kill great many em beſides time gibellines called white pope long premeditated expedition jeruſalem ſends biſhop apamea philip king france exhort ſame deſign went came thither could good fair word fain make uſe menace philip angry threw priſon pope underſtood ſent archdeacon narbonne thither ſecond year jubilee charles valois went charles second couſin whoſe coming frederick aragon concernd deſired peace obtained upon condition reſtoring taken italy ſhould keep sicily long lived modeſtly chriſt king diſciples true follower let em deſire rather beloved feared uſually juſt bane tyrant ſay cheriſhd feud among italian eſpecially genoeſes venetian two state powerful sea benedict xi benedict eleventh italian treviſo formerly calld nicolas cardinal oſtia made pope firſt november rome enterd himſelf order preacher young ſo far prevailed upon fraternity virtue learning preferrd gradually office till made general station choſen pope place alſo gave great demonſtration virtue lived ſuch manner may well reckond among number thoſe bliſs ſoon got apoſtolical chair cite nogaretius sarra thoſe anagni conſpired take boniface come appearing laid heavy curſe upon likewiſe heard king philip cauſe abſolvd boniface cenſures receivd john james two cardinal columna favour boniface perſecuted guelphian faction became pope nay gave em good onely enjoynd em let red hat boniface taken em lie ſome ſhort time ſetled affair city manner made ſome cardinal nicolas prateſe order preacher one immediately applies himſelf procure general peace italy becauſe greater tumult tuſcany elſe ſent nicolas biſhop oſtia thither full commiſſion made new officer florence put em houſe built reception magiſtrates called palais lord time nicolas thought might ſo therefore ſpoke recalling perſons baniſhd propoſal taking effect would declared curſe upon went prato long benedict dying tuſcany uproar baniſhd place met near bologna reſolving immediately enter florence thereupon night getting wall finiſhd near gate lead bologna advanced far church separata begun built little whilſt lookd eagerly plunder conſulted friend beſt gave enemy time take courage raiſe arm inſomuch quickly drave em killed great many men got robert duke calabria general grown confident ſtrength enough onely defend attaque neighbour hereupon beſiege piſtoia thoſe within ſo bravely defend one sally beat robert army back prato benedict good holy man reſolvd quieted italy aſſiſt againſt tartar fallen syria without ſcruple ſo court rome tranſlated france year 1305 remained ſeventy four year great damage chriſtendom eſpecially rome church great part em fell ruin want uſe whilſt abſent ought taken care catelano eminent perſon troop horſe gariſon dego ſeeing could contein people ferrara within duty fair foul word ſent horſe upon caſtle killd great many hanging eight twenty houſe eſte aſpird dominion time henry lucenburgh choſen emperor german confirmd pope upon condition ſhould come italy within two year receive crown rome pope end commotion italy would ſuppreſsd arrival emperor promiſed perform pope injoynd immediately ſent agent italy state prince chiefly florentine time haraſsd arezzo florentine made anſwer ſo great prince prudently endeavouring bring foreiners italy country emperor ought defend ſuch utmoſt power well protect arezzo knew baniſhd guelphs fellow citizen whereas emperor prerogative alone baniſh recall exile ſay dante told florentine blind making ſuch fooliſh anſwer emperor nothing could diſadvantage state eſpecially ſo great warlike prince ſo great army approached indeed encouraged promiſes king robert went kingdom gave aſſurance would always patron guelphin gibellins guido fearing leſt viconti ſhould get henry favour upon account faction raiſed army encamped country millain ſee himſelf ſaid durſt come city without leave ſame time maffeo ſent agent maffeo captain general horſe thus emperor gotten poſſeſſion millain almoſt adjacent city ſurrendred preſently except aleſſandria received iron crown millain according cuſtom put citizen ſo much expence commonalty finding themſelves rather oppreſſed veſted liberty expected betook themſelves arm german ſeeing men killd faction went suburb city called head party em galeatius son maffeo viconti left father home went conſiderable number suppliant wait upon emperor told turriani affecting sovereignty made uproar city whereupon german joyning gibellin faction drave turriani ſome ſmall reſiſtance martes newſtreet city whence fled great number vercelli perſuaſion guido thirty faction killd four turrianos henry moved toward cremona crema called guelphs turnd gibellins dealt mildly cremoneſes becauſe rendered themſelves ſo freely though little ſeverer upon cremeſes demoliſhd wall ſtrook ſuch terror thoſe parma perſuaſion one gilbert correggio received roſſi town immediately drove guelphs took emperor lieutenant thoſe breſcia defended themſelves ſome time ſmartly attaqued henry fled night mountain left city quite empty german enterd preſently pulled wall calamity neighbour people mantua verona vicenza padua treviſo venice ſo affrighted immediately ſubmitted emperor order thoſe alſo piacenza turnd albertus scotus captain guelphs took emperor governour ſetled bloodſhed every city nay every little caſtle citizen ſlain old men murtherd young child daſhd againſt ground boundleſs cruelty whereupon clement uſed ſaying homer let one chief lord one judg matter kindly received onely nobility citizen general crownd three cardinal made roman ſwear allegiance cuſtom made great feaſt invited nobleman city except ʋrſins leſt ſuch concourſe people ſhould ariſe ſparing ſupplying proviſions falling ſick went bath macerata whence came back bonconvento much weaker ſome day died ſuſpected poiſond monk florence induced large reward promiſes give euchariſt dipped lucca pope hearing eſteſes routed church force ferrara gotten totally hand viſcounts aſſiſtance lewis bavaria made themſelves maſters millain ſaid would let eſteſes alone interdicted viſcounts though ſo angry lewis uſurped title emperor ſame time gibellins genoa baniſhd fellowcitizens guelphs aſſiſted king robert committed government city fled great number savona ſome time robert perſecuted em vercelli turrianoes lord city viſcount galeatius command lewis emperor prevented charles expelled turrianoes vercelli came upon city became ſubject viſcounts long caſtruccio get piſtoia guido petramala little tipherno though florentine withſtood caſtruccio relying upon aid viſcount galeatius ſent son accio one thouſand five hundred soldier aſſiſt purſud beat florentine back wall killing making john viterbo biſhop mean time nicolas eſte lord ferrara ſtormd took argenta town belonging church ravenna aſſiſtance paſſerino bonacoſſio lord mantua little married nicolass siſter theſe two alſo joynd force attempted bologna went great loſs defeated beltrando commanded churchforces long curſed pope ferraria interdicted till reſtored argenta— caſtruccio time torment florentine taken segna alſo took modena aſſiſtance fatherinlaw one guido gonziaco whoſe daughter married philippino gonzaza rheggio voluntarily yielded citizen ſame time growing power maſtino scala gotten parma lucca padua columna dignity senator uſurpd himſelf dignity tribune theſe title ſay franciſco baroncello secretary senate grace god ſecond tribune mother city conſul rome pope heard mind rebate audacious ſpirit man ſent nicolas de gencio perſon full ambitious goal avignion rome recover tribuneſhip came city aſſiſted nobility great part common threw boroncello capitol killd ſo enjoyd tribuneſhip alone long forgetting former condition perſecuted nobility eſpecially columneſes going exquiline gate campagna di rom petition repelled ſo much diſadvantage betook himſelf capitol thence endeavourd eſcape enemy followd heel though diſguiſed yet citizen rome diſcoverd cut head guido jordan made ſole senator year apoſtolical authority time emperor son king bohemia kindly entertaind carrariens gonziacks viconti receivd iron crown cuſtom millain going thence piſa met embaſſadors sieneſes thoſe volaterra almoſt tuſcany told ready obey command florentine would done ſame firſt bought themſelves dominion great ſum money went rome crowned two cardinal ſent purpoſe upon condition ſhould ſtay longer either rome italy made depart ſooner gone giles legate quickly recoverd almoſt town uſurpers gotten inſtigation bavarian either romagna marca ancona peter patrimony confirmd thoſe lieutenans town ſaw obedient church rome galiot malateſta guido poletanus romagna vatraneſes dutchy millain • delaphi diſobedient church perſecuted two year war length quite routed forli impopili ceſena theſe indeed might reteind ſome part dominion aſſiſtance james cardinal columna man great friend family choſe rather loſe whole like men ſave part ſneakingly giles quieted romagna ſo pleaſed forli laid onely treaſure church alſo money ſent avignion italy build caſtles town made ſome ordinance province uſes day giles ſetled italy built great many neceſſary fort church dominion reduced italian prince state obedience succeſſor fifth year embaſſy called arduinus burgundian abbot ciſteaux man fit buſineſs wherefore giles gone prince state italy took arm piſans ſo moleſt florentine ſeeing body durſt oppoſe em plunderd country florence took figino caſtle lying river arno burning village built thereabout time pandulphus malateſta captain general florentine army people forced relinquiſh civil government becauſe never ſhewn courage enough engage enemy piſans much higher ſo much hope taking city ſhould bring ſcandal upon therefore ſome light skirmiſhes gate returnd home great ſpoils beginning autumn bernabos alſo demoliſhed many caſtles bologna haraſsd war though abbot clugny defended ſtoutly bologna told ſubject viconti aulegianus betrayd abbot clugny fermo reward treachery whilſt bernabos made war upon bologna reggio apoſtolical legate make alliance philippino gonzaga cane verona nicolas eſte go againſt breſcians bernabos concernd danger thoſe breſcia left bologna reggio marchd toward enemy ſo defeated montclere afterwards could hardly defend wall city ſame time florentine overcame piſans command galeot malateſta corrupting soldier come party reaſon piſans laid fault upon cambacurti eminent citizen becauſe paid soldier covetouſly ſtingily therefore recalld john agnellus baniſhd friend bernabos againſt cambacurti little time reduced city made acknowledg governour removed friend adverſe faction pope made peace piſans florentine one john haucut uſed fight piſans got together soldier italy gave people occaſion fear eſpecially ſince rome ſuch uproar chooſing senator innocent eaſily appeaſed diſcords ſending forein senator em called raimund ptolomy citizen siena bore office whole year year 1359 though thing ſetled manner yet roman could quiet turnd senator created ſeven citizen sovereign power called reformer whole republick upon account innocent made hugo luſignaneus king cyprus going war againſt turk senator commanded totally aboliſh society reformer time intent upon making end war betwixt england france might go againſt turk engliſh overcome french poictou taken king philip son thought done great exploit yet ſame time edward princely generoſity give captive liberty upon condition would never fight againſt ſoon broke thoſe term peace forced edward reſume arm beſiege paris innocent deſignd alſo prepare navy againſt infidel ſame time piſans excellent seaman venetiano great navy war former florentine latter lewis king hungary king beſiege treviſo great army beſides venetian variance among themſelves marino general accuſed aſpired sovereignty beheaded innocent thus diſcompoſed mind died ninth year eighth month ſixth day pontificate juſt ſame time bartholus saxoferratus wiſeſt man age pope death ſuch eclipſe sun never wherefore people thought ſuch great man could die even planet would give ſome preſages departure ʋrban v urban fifth lymoſin formery called griſant abbot victor marſeilles made pope abſence univerſal conſent time gone italy legate viconti called avignion enterd upon popedom ſooner got chair perſon ſingular virtue great courage innocent converſation immediately applyd himſelf vindicate church liberty made uſe ſuch inſtruments zealous buſineſs ſent giles spaniard ſaid ſomething italy full power authority ſo far animated engaged lewis gonzaga nicolas eſte franciſco carrario againſt bernabos overcome loſt son battel wounded hardly eſcaped life enemy took andrew pepulo bolognian banditto synebald ordelaphus paulus mirandula guido foliano azo corrigia william cavalcabos moſt signal commander army king england france cyprus concernd misfortune viconti ſent embaſſadours giles deſire would make peace embaſſadours ſent vain peace concluded though long continuance john hawkwood behalf viconti engaged florentine routed army miniato cauſed giles legate ſend thomas obicio excellent commander three thouſand horſe competent number foot help florentine fought betwixt arezzo cortona four hour together ſtoutly length thomas chiefly aſſiſtance infantry gave enemy ſuch blow ſix thouſand horſe fought hawkwood eſcaped captain himſelf yielded thoſe revolted church heard great victory immediately ſurrenderd ʋrban came italy fourth year pontificate ſettle thing giles legate met corneto rendring account done diſchargd legateſhip pope going way corneto rome retired quietly old age viterbo died three month man ſingular virtue courage preſervd honour church whilſt lived moſt wonderfully body carried aſſiſi buried church francis tomb built himſelf whilſt living charles emperor underſtood ʋrban gone rome went thither faſt could wife child way took lucca piſanes sancto miniato florentine whether went rome certain becauſe ti ſaid received imperial crown pope innocent sixth ſent cardinal oſtia rome purpoſe received great ſum mony florentine buy peace marchd italy third month came thither year 1368 ʋrban ſought long time head s peter paul ignorance time long neglected light upon sanctum sanctorum put em silver caſes next great altar lateran highly honour • great concourſe clergy people rome ſame pope built one palace old city another montefiaſcone pope might retire thither avoid heat buſtle town reſolving go back ſhortly france made john hawkwood excellent commander releaſed priſon general thoſe force ſervd giles guard church patrimony till returnd deſignd return italy going france died marſeilies eighth year fourth month pontificate others dyd avignion juſt time briget devout woman princeſs switzerland came rome upon vow ſhe made ſame time ſome commotion puglia death nicolas acciolo governour province stout wiſe man gregory xi gregory eleventh lymoſin formerly calld peter belford cardinaldeacon new mary made pope avignion general conſent clement vi uncle made cardinal ſcarce ſeventeen year age might ſeem conſult good kindred church ſent beſt maſters could find breeding eſpecially baldus time profeſſor perugia made ſuch progreſs ſorts learning baldus often uſed authority clear doubt man ſuch innocence good nature affability piety generally beloved entrance upon pontificate ſtate thing italy rome court juſtice held senator pope appointed every ſix month guard city management publick affair hand bandereſii ſo named banner teutonic word uſed war every decuria called capo di regione head ward diſtinguiſhd lombardy thoſe noble ſaid conſpired againſt viconti ſurpriſed city reggio treachery poſſeſſion caſtle holding bernabos entring city way firſt onſet overthrew enemy driving away lucius german commander repoſſeſsd himſelf place thus went matter italy perinus king cyprus ſucceeded father peter cauſe great animoſities genoeſes venetian crownd famagoſta two bailiff merchant call reſidents one genoa venice attending ſtrove ſhould walk right hand king raiſed ſuch tumult genoeſes beaten wounded baſely king favouring venetian genoeſes hereupon got navy 40 ship together command peter fregoſo brother dominick fregoſo invaded cyprus landed fourteen thouſand men deſtroy iſland fire ſword violating law nation king deſerted ſides ſubmitted mercy ſurrendering famagoſta promiſed genoeſes give 40000 per annum purchaſe peace pope legate come italy ſetled ſtate church made peace viconti new tumult aroſe prato original great confuſion inhabitant prato endeavouring vindicate themſelves dominion florentine called church force tuſcany permiſſion legate florentine ſo far corrupted money enterd prato aſſiſtance put conſpirators death ſent great many banner liberty written upon ſeveral troop ſeveral town exhorting people lord would remember liberty church caſt yoke servitude firſt revolted church caſtellani perugians thoſe todi spoleto gubio viterbo forli aſcoli followd example time aſtorgius manfred bavarian taſted ſweetneſs abſolute dominion poſſeſsd himſelf granariolo caſtle near faenza againſt legate ſent john hawkwood ſome troop bologna florentine thoſe bologna defended aſtorgius keeping hawkwood men aſſerted liberty hawkwood ſeeing faenzeſes ready rebel onely plunderd city ſeverely killd soldier met ſold ground ſtood nicolas albert eſte two brother 20000 l reſerving onely bagnacavallo himſelf carriage army lay pope hearing ſuch great revolution ſent cardinal cevennes legate ſix thouſand britiſh horſe ito italy coming piedmont marchd far gate bologna without hurt deſigning beſiege city legate heard florentine come aſſiſtance bolognians conduct rodolphus varraneo went army winter ceſena city ſuch upooar reaſon pride french ſix hundred britain ſlain reſt turnd town got afterward way tower increaſed number filld place bloud rapine ſparing even thoſe whoſe age made excuſe onely young woman maid kept alive abuſed thoſe forli fearing leſt want advice one govern might oppreſsd legate took synebald pyne john theobald ordelaphi lord city bravely defended fury britain pope gregory conceiving miſchiefs italy proceeded abſent long ſhipwrack affair happend becauſe pilot way good man intent good upon journey italy mightily concerned certain biſhops word asked pope walking together return church ought left ſo long without paſtor replyd greateſt biſhop give good example go biſhoprick rome pope diſturbd theſe word therefore got ready one twenty ship rhoan pretence going elſewhere might ſtopd french would underſtood going rome becauſe intereſt keep court france thereupon went firſt genoa corneto whence went land weary ſailing winter eſpecially rome arrived year 1376 11 january ſeventh year pontificate died navy well conqueror conquered brought zara whither genoeſes ſent peter auria room deceaſed brother nine galley many veſſels taking account brother victory found two thouſand captive beſide burnd grado comachio cahorle thence went chioza though defended ſome time venetian yet took laſt aſſiſtance supply governour padua ti certain full ſix thouſand men ſlain siege nine hundred fifty bombarda ie gun newly invented certain german called bombarda thundering ſound venetian skiff two thoſe gun whereby genoeſes ignorant unskilld new kind fighting many em deſtroyd gun often killing two three men one ſhot becauſe able avoid ſo well board ſhoar hereupon venetian bad bernabos viconti friend ally preſs upon genoeſes ſo raiſe siege already wanting proviſions indeed venetian muſt periſhed carrara adviſed genoeſes taken care hinder ſupplies imported venice bernabos give ſome ſatiſfaction venetian ſent army againſt genoeſes plunderd valley pulcephera taken nineteen thouſand left genoeſes fought againſt bernabos sword gold loaded themſelves spoil returnd millain aſtorgius faenza ſo good luck ſent thither bernabos horſe coming toward city routed people genoa ſallied upon eſcaped much ruffus lord padua promiſed ſhortly ſupply ſurrenderd town firſt july 1380 time taken enemy 4340 though died siege famine sword yet genoeſes though receivd ſuch fatal blow could lie ſtill thirty eight galley compelled trieſteſes revolt venetian patriarch aquilegia likewiſe took juſtinople caſtle recruited navy went venice body encountring returnd iſtria took city pola burnd many ſlaughters followed ſides venetian overcome land fight carrara whilſt james caballus excellent commander defended treviſo ſtoutly almoſt forcd famine ſurrender ſides well tired ſuch long bloody war duke savoy upon 23d september 1381 make peace upon theſe term venetian every tenth year ſhould pay king hungary ſeven thouſand pound provided kept part dalmatia free pirate ſuffer salt made dominion patriarch aquilegia ſhould ſame power friuli war venetian genoeſes orderd ſend home others captive without mention spoil taken either ſide padueſes commanded draw siege treviſo demoliſh tower fort raiſed fen mouth gibellins thence moving toward florence repelld john hawkwood time quarterd • agia florentine fearing ſhould able endure ſhock ſuch mighty king purchaſed peace rate 40000 l diſcharged hawkwood without naples ſurrender queen beſieged caſtelnovo guelphs arezzo made tumult forced james caracciolo citizen naples ſent thither king fly caſtle gibellins alſo fled thither whoſe good juſt man conſulted much guelphs deſired carry every thing alike equity caſes wherefore ſent albrick barbianus todi upon account injury revivd went city whilſt ſtrove reduce guelphs plunderd gibellins alſo ferraback another general followd albrick took remaining ſpoil could find arezzo whilſt theſe thing tranſacted naples arezzo new cloud war overcaſt italy lewis anjou blood royal france enterd italy thirty thouſand horſe poſted himſelf far bologna ſet clement antipope ſo much free queen joan beſieged force depoſe ʋrban reaſon charles left arezzo ſent albrick ferraback alſo frorentines ſent john hawkwood requeſt ʋrban lewis going marci come far foreſt caſſino expecting twelve thouſand horſe already come italy command andegranius marching viacenza lucca florence siena arrived arezzo let guelphs ſackd city albrick given em fatal blow gibellins defended caſtle beſieged forty day taken french lewis anjou died mean time andegranius ſeeing thing went advice people arezzo beſieged caſtle ſold city florentine ſo returnd france anjouen soldier deſtitute general wandered home two three company begging way ʋrban deliverd fear french went naples asd leave king make nephew prince campania could obtain clowniſh uncivil temper would interpreted blunt downright honeſty began threaten provoked king ſo far ſet guard upon ſome day would ſuffer walk street affront ſeemed wink time king good leave went nocera avoid himſelf ſaid heat city fortified town made ſome new cardinal impriſond ſeven old one charging upon conſpiracy king antipope againſt beſides commanded proceſs ſpeak phraſe againſt king ſent citation appear anſwer would come ſhortly nocera acquit himſelf crime objected word weapon order thereunto came nocera competent army beſieged town raymund balcianus family ʋrſins son earl nola afterward prince taranto concernd indignity force commanded king carried ʋrban whole court next shore put em board certain genoeſe galley prepared purpoſe way pope ſailed genoa took ſeven cardinal nocera put five baggs drowned sea upon death lewis king hungary nobility country ſent preſently charles going thither called convention eſtates ſetling affair whilſt buſie upon queen owd grudg procurd murtherd year 1385 juſt time john galeatius put viſcount bernabos uncle ſide father galeatius priſon monza kept long livd enjoyd eſtate formerly divided patrimony pavia vercelli novara tortona aleſſandria place toward apennine mountain alp fell galeatius piacenza cremona parma lauden breſcia pergamo bernabos millain common ʋrban paſsd whole year genoa news brought florentine incited city belonging church aſſert liberty done formerly upon went firſt lucca siena perugia thoſe city confirmd allegiance coming went far ferentino pretence ſeeing naples true deſign turn ladiſlaus child john son charles paternal inheritance many nobleman favourd lewis anjou gave hope enjoying kingdom thoſe gajetta faithful preſerving child alive ſaved kingdom great honour pope therefore returnd rome able effect deſign receivd city great pomp though long bandereſii laid wait yet eſcaped fruſtrated created one day twenty nine cardinal three roman reſt almoſt neapolitan mean antonius scala verona francis elder lord padua engaged bloody war john ʋ baldin lead army carrareſes john ordelafo scaligeri galeatius viconti aſſiſtance carrareſes conquerd scaligeri took verona vincenza ſo contented month beſieged took padua impriſond francis carrara monza francis son eſcaping flight florentine alſo willing encreaſe dominion took montepulciano luſignano two town territory siena stratagem rather ſtrength afterward ſent charles son bernabos antony scala five thouſand horſe country siena forage movd galeatius ſuch degree diſpatchd embaſſadors florence complain contrary league heretofore made florentine entertaind pay enemy charles viconti antony scala againſt right juſtice haraſsd friend ally sienneſes fine embaſſadors commanded declare war againſt except drew force siennois disbanded thoſe officer leſt galeatius ſhould good word peter gambacorta lord piſa friend florentine interpoſed undertook make buſineſs mean time ʋrban dyd rome eleventh year eighth month unhappy pontificate buried peter church little mourning ruſtical inexorable man sepulchre tomb yet ſeen rude ſilly inſcription upon boniface ix boniface ninth neapolitan formerly called peter tomacello made pope rome general conſent cardinal year 1389 though thirty year old enterd upon popedom yet lived ſo ſtrictly florid age thoſe wicked time act luſt inordinate pleaſure could charged upon ſeemed changed youth boniface ix chair galeatius made war upon florentine bolognians general john ʋbaldin lantedeſcus petramala valley arno plunderd ſpoild far near james vermis likewiſe enterd territory bolognia upon great commander king ladiſlaus paul ʋrſin came upon order pope moſtarda cecchalino routed john columna ladiſlauss men left place called nero mead great damage roman men cattel driven away therefore carrara venetian cardinal mark called gregory xii peter philardi candiot cardinal twelve apoſtles afterward alexander otho columna cardinal george called martin v thus ſetled popedom created lewis novem 2 1406 immediately writing hand notary witneſs confirmd promiſed pontificate ſet hand came diſcourſe place might meet without danger could agree eſteemed aſſemblies cardinal better shuffler haraſsd roman inroad forcd ſue peace receive honourably city governour changed civil officer fortified according mind gate wall paul ʋrſin general churchforces came upon fought ſtoutly septimiano near james loſt great many men ſide king kept men farther ſide tiber ſuppoſing ſhould ſafer place reaſon naval force brought oſtia rome laſt yielding rather flying ʋrſin faction increaſed every day went naples party much weakend victory obtaind came thither columneſes fought john columna baptiſta sabellus james ʋrſin nicolas columna taken laurences gate got city paul ʋrſin came told moſt em taken vanquiſhd two put death one galeot famous norman cavalier called richard sanguineus noble ancient family reſt diſchargd upon condition would never fight ladiſlaus theſe trouble rome aroſe ſuch dearth proviſions rubio wheat ſold eighteen florin becauſe cattel driven away husbandman deſtroyd uſual war alexander v alexander fifth candia formerly called peter frier order minor archbiſhop millain man famous holineſs learning made pope conſent cardinal time piſan aſſembly gregory fled auſtria talkd general council thinking himſelf ſafe enough went rimini ſplendidly receivd charles malateſta benedict council perpignan fled caſtle paniſchola ſtrong place ſtaid good better ſecurity though depoſed council piſa yet created cardinal like true pope eſpecially gregory whilſt tarried lucca made gabriel condelmero cardinal conſent cardinal continud party gabriel elected pope called eugenius iv return alexander excellent man whole courſe life order minor youth took ſo much pain study paris humanity divinity ſoon became publick reader wrote acutely learnedly upon book sentence alſo reckond great orator great preacher therefore ſent john galeatius duke millain made chief counſellor galeatiuss requeſt made biſhop vincenza tranſlated novara laſt made archbiſhop millain created cardinal twelve apoſtles innocent vii ſtep roſe pontifical dignity deſervedly ſtiled alexander becauſe might compare prince liberality greatneſs mind ſo munificent poor deſerved bounty ſhort time left himſelf nothing made uſe ſay joke rich biſhop poor cardinal beggarly pope free deſire getting increaſeth uſually man eſtate age vice cannot found among good men contemn world older grow leſs viaticum proviſion know ſhall want journey therefore reſtrain deſires bridle covetouſneſs extinquiſh evil luſts nay alexander perſon courage depoſe powerful king ladiſlaus abſence ſeveral pope long time much ſpoild haraſsd church dominion taken ſome town force piſa council approbation preſent declared kingdom belong lewis duke anjou council piſa brake pope went bologna baldeſar coſſa cardinal euſtachius governour alexander confirmd office becauſe induſtry conduct council held piſa becauſe man fit oppoſe uſurpers ſuch encroached upon church revenue yet ruſticity boldneſs worldlineſs profeſſion required led military life manner soldierlike took liberty many thing fit named alexander ſick knew death near exhorted cardinal viſited concord peace defend honour church ſwore death juſt undergo conſcience wellacted life think believe thing decreed piſan council juſtice integrity without deceit fraud ſaid people weeping ſtood repeated ſaying saviour much ado peace give unto peace leave immediately dyd eighth month pontificate buried bologna church frier minor year famine plague john xxiv john twenty fourth noble neapolitan formerly called coſſa baldeſar choſen pope bologna general conſent though ſome ſay election carried force becauſe legate bologna soldier city country planted purpoſe ſo could get fair mean would foul however moſt certain made pope always aſpired dignity youth ſtudied civil law bologna ſome year took degree according cuſtom went rome askd ſome friend whether going anſwerd pontificate came rome entertaind boniface ix made one privy chamber made cardinal euſtachiuss ſent legate à latere bologna ſhort ſpace ſubjected church together great part romagna beating aut ſome uſurpers putting others death nine year enlarged city bologna wonderful manner long peace gotten great deal money alexander died uſed bribery eſpecially cardinal gregory made yet poor ſo made pope thereupon ſent agent elector empire deſire em would chooſe sigiſmund lucenburg king hungary bohemia emperor perſon ſtout fit ſaid brave action way get sigiſmundss favour ſucceeding according mind told em beforehand whereas orderd aſſembly piſa council ſhould calld ſuch certain time would hold rome elſe might freer acceſs thither endeavourd ſettle italy eſpecially part near alp war daily encreaſe inſtigation fazinus canis could keep mercenary soldier command without employment uſed maintain rapine plunder juncture happend pavians philip could contain awe reaſon minority grown factious took arm gibellins conduct beccarian family brought fazinus army city guelphs eſtates fazinus entering town soldier ſpared neither one plunderd gibellins complaind good plunderd againſt promiſe replyd gibellins perſons ſhould ſafe good guelphs would give spoil soldier deriding folly covetouſneſs faction went thence left good gariſon gate fort pretending philip protector till grew age ſo went againſt pandulphus malateſta teazed breſcians bergameſes frequent inroad ravaging ſpare thoſe cremona time governd cabrinus fundulus theſe tranſactions king hungary going pretended rome freely receive imperial crown ſent twelve thouſand horſe eight thouſand foot againſt venetian ſeizing friuli ſet upon treviſo againſt great army venetian ſent charles malateſta keep ſo much fighting protracting time venetian like alſo loſt verona ſame year treachery ſome citizen mind ▪try could get violence preſerve liberty thoſe guilty puniſhd end fazinus canis died ſame year ſeveral perſons conſpiring together killd john maria duke millain took bernaboss son nephew city philip perſuaſions friend married beatrice fazinuss widow rich authority soldier fought husband fazinus mean city paid homage fazinus preſently ſurrenderd drew carmignola siccus montagnanus ſeditiouſly divided legion fazinuss death come fight colour perſwaſions beatrice two commander philip made bologna command pope john whoſe banner fought malateſta rimini ſtipendiary king ladiſlaus laid cloſe siege city time therefore aid bolognians fought ſeveral ſharp battels enemy better defended city moſt gloriouſly winter following pope john invaded ladiſlaus made remove rome florence thence bologna ſtay long went mantoua ſplendidly entertaind john francis gonzaga took along departure thence together great part force lodi whither knew king hungary would come truſted much prince whoſe faithfulneſs integrity ſuch experience bolognian war though tempted malateſta gift promiſes revolt king party pope king think themſelves ſufficiently ſafe lauden ſent john francis mantoua whether ſaid theyd go ſpeed prepare coming reception ſuch multitude went quickly made thing ready returned cremona heard pope king time arrived conducted mantoua people came thronging meet much kindly receivd expected theſe ſeveral meeting lodi cremona mantoua conſiderd ſhould remove ladiſlaus campagna di rom ombria tuſcany taken rome many town belonging church ſaw italy could freed diſtractions war mean therefore thought convenient adviſe concerning ſupply carry affair mantoua bologna come thither greater concern ſtill upon john urged call council conſent nation removal schiſm immediately ſent two cardinal germany adviſe prince france germany chooſe convenient place council held upon enquiry conſtance city within province mentze ſeemed moſt commodious purpoſe thereupon went thither certain day according order ſo likewiſe pope john himſelf though ſome adviſed contrary becauſe told feard went thither pope would return thence private perſon ſo fell going thither certain men excellent ſorts learning puzled german ſo long tedious diſputations could tell decree sigiſmund came gave every body leave ſay pleaſed great grievous crime laid pope charge upon went privately diſguiſe conſtance scaphuſa fear ſome dangerous plot might contrived againſt scaphuſa city belonging duke auſtria whither ſeveral cardinal alſo created betook themſelves called authority council john fled scaphuſa friburgh deſigning go poſſibly could ſafety duke burgundy care council john taken impriſond near conſtance iſle mark fourth year pontificate tenth month council began enquire reaſon flight chooſe ſeveral perſons great gravity learning delegate examine weigh objection made againſt john make orderly report council forty article proved againſt ſome containd fault ſo habituated could avoid therefore judged contrary faith ſome likely bring ſcandal upon chriſtianity general condemned wherefore ſince agreed ſame opinion john deſervedly juſtly depoſed approved sentence though pronounced againſt thereupon preſenty ſent lewis bavarian gregory 12ths friend kept cuſtody till order council accordingly blockd caſtle haldeberg well fortified place three year without chamberlain servant attend italian keeper german fain talk nod sign becauſe neither underſtood teutonick language italian ſay john depoſed thoſe men alone formerly friend thoſe gregory benedict party yet come council theſe men therefore might make deprivation juſt perfect one accord publiſhd synodical decree wherein affirmd general council agent council king england france perſwaded ſake chriſtianity ſo much endangerd schiſm aſſiſt two laid removal benedict anſwering mind went ſtraight ferdinand king aragon whoſe subject generally ſtood pontificate nay even cardinal peter ſide heard ultimate reſolution pope council went peter deſired laſt remove schiſm church god chriſtendom ſo many year afflicted told john gregory done ſame order obſerving obſtinacy immediately revolted martin thoſe two continued ſide preſently counted anticardinals one carthuſian called julian dobla upon spain acknowledged martin authority ſo scot thoſe armagnac long ſo chriſtendom except one peninſula owned authority martin great affair thus ſetled pain induſtry eccleſiaſtick ſecular prince eſpecially sigiſmund emperor began talk reforming manner laiety clergy debauched much licence becauſe council conſtance laſted already four year great inconvenience prelate church martin pleaſure opinion council weighty affair ſhould deferred till ſome ſeaſonable opportunity ſaid work would require much time deliberation becauſe jerome ſays every country peculiar manner cuſtoms cannot eaſily removd without great diſturbance becauſe schiſm ſmall beginning laſted long time great diſadvantage chriſtendom upon notice john xxiii eſcaped cuſtody fearing leſt ſhould call another council publiſhd decree concerning calling council end council church chappels holy martyr pope abſence either ruin ready fall therefore muſt gone thither deſired em take kindly reaſon neceſſity forced would let ſit peter chair ſince unanimouſly choſen pope church rome mother head church therefore pope ought reſide leſt true pilot ſhould diſplaced stern stem great hazard detriment paſſengers sailers ie chriſtian men went conſtance savoy italy arrived millain kindly received duke philip people gave reſpect imaginable philip time arm endeavouring recover paternal inheritance uſurpers kept great bravery courage taſted pleaſant govern eaſily turnd poſſeſſion however carmignola philip chief commander preſsd pandulphus malateſta hard taken pergamo bribing governour betray caſtle moved toward breſcia would quickly ſtripd dominion aided venetian great ſums money ſtout cavalry pope martin perſuaded philip make peace pandulphus accordingly afterward compoſed agreed upon mantoua preſence martin umpirage john franciſco upon theſe term wit pandulphus paying yearly tribute ſhould keep breſcia ſo long lived ſhould power give away becauſe death naturally devolvd upon philip next year pandulphus broke peace endeavouring men money keep cabrinus fundulus poſſeſſion cremona philip made war againſt endeavoured regain city paternal inheritance ſo many year poſſeſsd uſurper yet report pandulphus bought city cabrinus promiſed give riviera di salo john franciſco ſtrove could keep war ſent embaſſadors tell contrary law reaſon violating league defending tyrant taking arm againſt gave government breſcia martin authority ought ſlighted ſay marriage lewis reſpect relation joined battel wherein lewis baſely routed long carmignola reduced breſcia made ſubject philip alſo within little maſter cremona put cabrinus uſurper death nicolas eſte movd philip great ſucceſs went accord might forced went millain reſtored parma poſſeſsd himſelf otho third died philip kept rheggio requeſt pope martin fee thither alſo went john francis prince mantoua congratulate philip succeſſes ſaw philip look gruffly upon underſtood deſignd renew claim held cremoneſes breſcians went millain haſte enterd alliance florentine venetian thoſe two state timorous took pain draw could party becauſe philip loved dominion broken league onely given sarzana upon river magra thomas fregoſo expelled principality leſt ſhould join bandittoes genoa againſt alſo incited bolognians ally florentines▪ revolt order hired soldier fight nay got poſſeſſion forli colour nonage theobald gratifie prince ferrara whereas proviſo league philip ſhould meddle bologna romagna feared likewiſe leſt would carried power three mighty prince wit philip pope martin king lewis knew confederate whereas ſide philip laid fault upon venetian becauſe endeavourd keep pandulphus government breſcia becauſe florentine genoeſes aſſiſted ſome enemy money ammunition bought legorne lately conquerd genoeſes hundred thouſand pound theſe ſeeds diſcord might ſeem enough raiſe war time nothing ſet venetian authority carmignola perſon mightily famed warlike diſcipline age perſon could endure uſed ſay himſelf inſolence philip therefore came venetian animating war promiſed aſſiſt em utmoſt whereupon theſe two state aſſiſted prince mantoua ferrara going partner charge war ſet army twelve thouſand horſe eight thouſand foot carmignola general ſetting upon philip every quarter boat upon river well ship upon sea invited town guelphs breſcia againſt philip ſeized ſome part reduced power within ſeven month carmignola led take caſtles belonged breſcia pope martin much concerned philip misfortune ſent cardinal croſſes venetian mediate philip ſucceed becauſe venetian florentine made unreaſonable demand ſo began mighty preparation war fought thrice year firſt cotolengo caſtle breſcia ſecond time upper part cremona two place parted pretty equal neither better ont third time maclodio philip defeated charles malateſta general taken ſo great overthrow carmignola would kept breſcians continud allegiance philip gave time breath upon onely made peace amadens duke savoy lay hard upon yielding vercelli inſtigated emperor sigiſmund branorus scala againſt venetian pope martin ſeeing philip ſuch dangerous circumſtances ſent cardinal croſſes make peace venetian ſtaying ferrara till ſeveral embaſſadors prince city came inſtructions made peace upon theſe condition venetian ſhould keep breſcia town belonging breſcians cremoneſes taken philip ſhould ſurrender bergamo appertaind venetian ſhould moleſt ally thoſe florentine perſwade em revolt martin approved peace fear found brachius montonius excellent soldier ſo far got poſſeſſion perugia dutchy spoleto great part church patrimony help uſurpers round could get ſafe rome brachius upon admonition would comply pope uſed firſt ſpiritual weapon cenſures againſt interdicted adherent prieſts allowed office uſual place misfortune friend brachius florentine concernd treated martin peace upon condition brachius ſhould whole conſiſtory reteind former dignity three cardinaldeacons fourth formerly canon regular cardinalprieſt baldeſar coſſa ſtill priſoner heidelberg germany count palatine ſome citizen florence coſmus one urgent pope martin ſet liberty pope promiſed would whilſt legate went thither perform baldeſar impatient ſtaying longer gave count palatine thirty thouſand pound free coming italy went directly toward florence calld upon peter rubeus baron parma old friend underſtood wait laid thereupon fled night along legate met way thomas fregoſos another old friend gave people ſuſpition schiſm would renewd man great courage cunning could endure private life beſides wanting ſuch would incite bold man innovation generally time ſo much affected novelty god almighty took pity church put baldeſar upon reſolution going martin florence without article agreement caution came thither kiſsd pope foot admiration ſaw ſaluted preſence hearing company name chriſts true vicar true pope canonically elected ſtrange ſaw brought paſs ſhould ſeem rather god providence humane skill man covetous dominion ſuch high station ſhould ſo ſupple place might free becauſe loved made every body cry joy eſpecially thoſe cardinal acknowledged true pope martin conſidering viciſſitude changeableneſs humane affair made cardinal day biſhop fraſcati ſhewd much reſpect cardinal publick private baldeſar ſome think died grief month florence unable endure private life buried moſt honourably john church far cathedral great coſt charge coſmo di medices grew ſo rich baldeſars money lookd upon chief man florence citizen nay perhaps richeſt italy world upon tomb written theſe word baldesaris cossae johannis xxiii qʋondam papae corpʋs hoc tʋmʋlo conditʋm theſe action florence emperor conſtantinoples agent came pope promiſed greek would come latin point faith upon reaſonable term pope receivd kindly ſplendidly made peter fonteſiccus spaniard cardinal angelo learned man legate à latere go conſtantinople ſettle matter ſent good man away diſpatchd frier anthony maſſanus thither general minor find emperor greek affected tell might truſt roman urgent come rome therefore taking leave kindly florentine made city metropolis though even foundation almoſt honour biſhoprick made archbiſhoprick motherchurch volaterra piſtoia fieſola alſo gave bigger altar mary new belonging order preacher lived florence convent commodious reception laſt parting florence came rome people met nobility lookd upon good genius father country sept 21 1421▪ day roman put calendar lucky one came found city rome ſo ruinated lookd nothing like city might ſeen houſes ready totter church fallen street empty city full dirt mire exteam want ſorts proviſions ſhould ſay neither face city ſign civility citizen ſeeming rather sojourner vagabond good pope troubled ſee applyd himſelf adorning city reforming citizen manner ſo ſhort time looked much better reaſon called people onely true pope father country leſt publick joy ſhould laſt long without interruption year following november st andrew eve tiber ſwelld ſo high came porta del popolo overflowd whole city lie upon level filled church mary round far great altar two day fell took much cattel along great damage citizen ſailed street upon tiber king lewis son lewis came rome obtaind martin inveſted king naples general conſent cardinal invited thither adopted queen joan siſter ladiſlaus expected mean get kingdom without fighting driven naples contrary faction retired calabria time council drawing near according decree conſtance martin pleaſed conſent cardinal ſend ſome biſhops pavia begin ſeeming moſt commodious place thither therefore immediately ſent peter donatus archbiſhop candia james camplo biſhop spoleto peter roſatius abbot aquilegia frier leonard florentine general preacher open council found body yet come france germany onely two abbot burgundy therefore thought fit defer till one leaſt ſhould come nation little moment tranſacted without univerſal conſent waited coming ſudden pavia viſited ſo ſeverely plague pope leave preſidents council removd sienna whither people came nation readily greater number pavia alphonſus king aragon enemy martin giving title king naples sicily lewis himſelf deſired ſent embaſſador council order delay much could bring cauſe antipope peter luna yet alive paniſchola either promiſes bribe thoſe greateſt authority council wherefore martin knew well great calamity ſuch thing would bring upon church danger delay commanded council immediately diſſolvd approving firſt decree made concernd matter faith leſt might ſeem fear general council orderd another ſhould held baſil ſeven year thus prudent ſubtil man root ſeeds schiſm diſcord ſown council siena alphonſo complaind martin publickly mean put kingdom joan deſigned lewis made heir room martin eaſily confuted charge told lewis confirmd heir joan alexander v john xxiii long blame ought laid queen upon whoſe buſineſs ſtrengthen rather weaken church feudataries unleſs committed ſome heinous offence againſt sea rome ſee lewis might lawful heir joan crownd order brachius ſaw pope involvd ſo many affair ſo diſtracted reaſon quarrel alphonſo got many churchtowns force laid cloſe siege aquila city kingdom naples pope angry raiſing good ſufficient army attempted relieve aquila aſſiſted army queen lewis far aquila conquerd killd brachius open field sfortians battel conduct francis son sforza ſome year going river piſcara ancient calld aternus drownd brachiuss body brought rome buried unhallowd place without porta di sancto lorenzo upon victory ſo great tranquillity beſides perugia todi aſſiſi ſome town brachius poſſeſſion reduced church thought auguſtuss happy day come world people lived eaſe could walk even night wood without danger robber abroad ruſſians thief cut tartalia lauellus uſurpers got living rather rapine war hereticks bohemia plagud catholicks germany continually hereſie arm ſeemed interrupt peace happineſs make therefore ſubmit reaſon church admoniſhd firſt gravely would ſent legats germany ſtir catholicks arm firſt ſent henry cardinal euſebius thither alone bartholomew piacenza laſt recalld ſent julian caeſarinus cardinal angelo receivd great damage enemy fault cowardiſe soldier however martin diſcouraged made greater preparation againſt hereticks onely ſet ſuch grand affair reſolvd compoſe quiet italy peace made martin philip venetian florentine bore grudg ladiſlaus son paul guiniſius lord lucca aſſiſtance gave philip preceding war mentiond article peace laid hold fair opportunity ſubdue city raiſed army nicolas fortebrachius taken ſome caſtles thereabout laid siege whereupon philip entreaty paul fear leſt lucca fell hand florentine ſhould find ſharper nearer enemy firſt ſent francis sforza parma great body horſe raiſe footſoldiers paſſing apennine beginning spring put florentine ſuch fright came cloudy vale inhabitant call enemy removed camp raiſed siege lucca fear coming ſo much welcome lucceſes becauſe enemy ſubdud uſurper taken thought become abſolute freeman franciss aſſiſtance florentine bribing francis fifty thouſand pound left people lucca worſe condition ever promiſed sum ſerve philip ſix month lucceſes beſieged cloſe whereupon philip requeſt martin alſo pitied caſe lucceſes ſent nicolas piceninus thither great body horſe preſently vanquiſhd routed enemy raiſed siege marchd thence took many caſtles belonging piſa volaterra ſtorm sieneſes kindneſs made war upon florentine martin undiſturbd forein foe applyd mind adorn city church rome purpoſe repaired portico peter falling paved lateran church moſaic work cieled anew began thoſe painting done hand famous gentilis likewiſe repaired old palace ready fall near twelve apoſtles lived ſome year cardinal followd example reedified church faſt could ſo rome lookd ſomething like city alſo created certain cardinal nephew proſper columna cardinal george one mean time peter luna dyd paniſchola leſt church ſhould quiet thoſe two anticardinals told perſuaded alphonſo martin enemy chooſe giles munio canon barſelona nobleman pope calld clement viii ſooner choſen made cardinal acted pope martin alphonſo friend ſent peter de fuſo cardinal legate sea apoſtolick thither giles reſignd title popedom command alphonſo martin ſo kind afterward made biſhop majorca cardinal alſo made giles voluntarily lay dignity thoſe two peter luna made remaind ſtill obſtinate therefore becauſe would obey pope legate put priſon thus martin induſtry prudence removed schiſm part church ſetled uſed much skill diſcretion conferring benefice beſtow em upon every one askd conſiderd fitteſt receive take ſuch charge upon know body country benefice fell uſed ſend enquire thoſe knew place qualified learning birth breeding fit office thus advance church deſerving men ſame time great honour fine ſo couragious reſolute though two brother elder jordanus prince salerno died plague lorenzo burnd death turret caſually ſet condelmero two made uſe gregory turnd martin many great affair eſpecially embaſſy marcha ancona confirmd inhabitant allegiance church puniſhing ſome ſeditious conſpirators alſo repaired church agnes ancona decayd port ſame city weatherbeaten old ruinous ſo make like trajan afterward martin underſtood bolognians ſet upon innovation ſent gabriel ancona thither ſuppreſsd sedition ſoon came coming lateran thence vatican ſet day general conſiſtory held ſuch concourſe people timber building met publick conſiſtory ſtands gave way put people ſuch conſternation biſhop sinigaglia citizen rome family mella trodden death throng pope houſe built time conſiſtory diſmiſsd eugenius took care avoid tumult ſome sycophant perſuading martin covetous left ſomewhere great treaſure behind might informd martin egging whoſe contrivance ti thought theſe thing done againſt colonneſes old grudg two faction eugenius however commanded oddo ſhould brought quietly civily quite contrarily executed stephen onely good plunderd soldier carried force rather draggd like robber publickly pope preſence eugenius angry rude uſage checked stephen nay threatend puniſh ſeverely bringing onely oddo biſhop tivoli formerly martin chamberlain ſuch unworthy manner hereupon stephen fearing pope diſpleaſure fled paleſtrina prince colonna deſired join drive eugenius city becauſe ſaid eugenius deſign extinguiſh whole family colonna knew ſo privy himſelf ran away city becauſe knew alſo muſt bear part common calamity unleſs avoided together prince moved ſaid miſfortunes ſuch martin friend took arm immediately reſolvd ſet upon pope ſtaying onely little till brother proſper cardinal deacon forewarnd buſineſs could get city ſoon ſaw marchd paleſtrina marino thence rome againſt eugenius gate di sancto sebaſtiano deliverd john baptiſta enterd town firſt without violence come far mark street called colonna pope soldier met aſſiſted great number people fought ſome time city ſtoutly many ſlain taken ſides colonneſes proſper cardinal colonneſes together thoſe martin friend thus incensd either ſide began make uſe treachery well open force bring deſigns archbiſhop benevento son anthony colonna taken one maſius frier torturd confeſsd intended kill governour caſtel angelo ſo taking ſurpriſe betray colonneſes maſters might drive pope ʋrſins rome pleaſed maſius degraded prieſthood quarterd campo di fiore limb hung diſpatchd nerius capponius citizen poſſible perſuade eugenius emperor coming city threaten leſs ruin sea apoſtolick florence eaſie matter keep paſſing arno siena moleſted florentine long time would buſineſs agreed florentine ſhould pay two thouſand horſe eugeniuss raiſing long war laſted nicolas tollentinas pope command marchd winterquarters whilſt pillaged sieneſes gave sigiſmund opportunity paſs river arno aſſiſtance anthony pontadera excellent commander bitter enemy florentine thence paſſing volaterra ſo peaceable manner army ſeemed rather friend foe received made welcome wherever came emperor tarried ſix month siena great coſt city vain attempted make peace florentine applying himſelf eugenius made league went rome kindly entertaind people pope receivd imperial crown going vatican crownd lateran lodgd knighted ſeveral italian german ponte di angelo according cuſtom ſome ſay eugenius waited ſo far went back peter emperor took leave pope travelling marcha ancona romagna arrived akin emperour becauſe father john imperial elector laſt emperor departed italy leaving thing confuſion nicolas eſte marquis ferrara perſuaded philip go venice exhort peace ſo inſomuch induced awe em conſidering great expences ſend plenipotentiary ferrara along conſent eugenius april 1 1433 peace concluded upon theſe condition wit philip ſhould depart geradada deliver marquis monteferrat orlando pallaricini turnd paternal inheritance taken florentine sieneſes thoſe lucca ſhould returnd owner ſhould lookd upon common enemy reſtore taken thirty day thus made peace part hoped ſome reſt ſudden whole ſhock war fell upon eugenius philip loved novelty ſent francis sforza great army romagna pretending march puglia alphonſo invaded defend thoſe town father sforza poſſeſsd marching ancona ombria army good order ſurpriſed took moment philip content ſo ſent nicolas fortebrachius valiant prudent commander choſen horſe ſo ſuddenly againſt eugenius poſſeſsd ponte molle porta del popolo known enemy approached nicolas formerly fought eugenius commiſſion ſubdud governor vetralla civita vechia help venetian galley attaqued caſtle sea nicolas afterward demanded pay eugenius anſwered taken much ſpoil caſtle eſpecially town would ſatisfie nicolas ſo angry went part rome raiſed ſuch tumult taking driving away ſuch number men cattel eugenius ſome time ſtand roman flockd complaint pope time wanted advice health ſent em francis chamberlain devoted idleneſs pleaſure gave em anſwer overvalued cattel often complaind loſs told em venetian lived like citizen without beaſts flock cattel roman nevertheleſs eugenius went away upon 7th july ſailed piſa firſt florence galley laid purpoſe paſſage roman betook themſelves ſtorm caſtle raiſing mound bulwark place might make acceſſible enemy ſide ridio governor ſwore would bring matter mind thereupon dismiſſed went caſtle hung anthony clothes ſomewhat like head top viſible great way baldeſar preſently cryd wicked fellow juſtly puniſhd ſome chief roman commander might come paid reward take caſtle aware trick went ſtrait taken immediately joyful noiſe caſtle dart bullet thrown ſhot upon roman without roman thus deluded adviſed concerning proviſions upon arrival john viteleſchus calld patriarch francis nephew gone eugenius ſudden dread ſeizd roman ſuch degree durſt ſo much open mouth fear viteleſchus imperious cruel man lived like tyrant rather chriſtian theſe thing tranſacted rome whilſt alphonſo beſieged naples cajetta ſtoutly defended genoeſe merchant genoeſes thinking duty aſſiſt countryman fitted navy ſpeed leave good entertaind captive enemy genoeſes king friend treated honourably ſome day preſented philip many great gift went kingdom took cajetta preſently upon genoeſes ſo enraged ſhould free alphonſo ſo eaſily taken ſuch hazard advice thomas fregoſo revolted philip made ſaid thomas duke picenninus ſent againſt genoeſes receiving news perſiſted obſtinacy took sarzana marching toward piſa pretence go help alphonſo ſpoiled many caſtles belonging piſans florentine ſtopped career ſending francis sfortia pope good liking poſſeſſion ancona endeavourd aſſiſtance florentine venetian made lord eugenius againſt ſaid became pope preſerve churchpatrimony even war rather alienate deferred buſineſs till another opportunity yet francis hope onely beat picenninus siege barga taking lewis gonzaga fought picenninus laid cloſe siege lucca name florentine picenninus hinderd paſſing apennine relief therefore promiſed free another way wherefore marchd bologna without moleſtation onely taking town belonging florentine called oriolo mindful lucceſes went thither abſence francis sfortia vanquiſhd florentine raiſed siege lucca pope almoſt diſtracted care well becauſe ſurrounded war council baſil begun decree pope martin increaſed daily conflux prince spain france germany hungary referrd caſe chriſtendom council contrived diſſolve purpoſe would removed baſil bologna general conſent cardinal ſide emperor prince prelate baſil onely diſobey pope admoniſhd ſeveral time come himſelf cardinal baſil convenient place martin choſen hold council elſe threatend oppoſe prevaricating obſtinate perſon eugenius moved word confirmed council baſil new breve giving every one leave go thither ſo tormented war ſides hardly time breath recoverd rome ſent john viteleſchus thither immediately man indeed fit buſineſs ſavage ſevere marching againſt colonneſes sabelli gibellin faction ſackd razed caſtle gandulpho ſtanding lago albano alſo savello borgeto likewiſe took alba civita lapuvina paleſtrina zagatolo ſent inhabitant alive rome turning courſe campagna di rom brought em church taken anthony pontadera hangd upon olivetree fraſelone coming back rome put em fear pulld ſeveral houſes conſpirators taken poſſeſſion porta maggiore tumult declared enemy church among reſt took one pulcellus torturd red hot pincer hangd campo fiore roman people complaind covetouſneſs ſome rich men brought famine upon country ſo much wheat immediately brought market order enſued great plenty thing ſhort time ſo readily command obeyd thus ſetled affair went kingdom naples alphonſo lately got poſſeſſion ſaid belonged pope church took prince tarento two thouſand horſe invaded dominion earl nola alſo like taken alphonſo fraud rather force made truce peace good concluded taken town belonging church freed prince going back rome demoliſhd paleſtrina ready rebel perſuaſion lorenzo colonna turned inhabitant great number roam country year 1435 year eugenius went florence firſt conſecrated cathedral church going bologna built fort near gate lead towards ferrara fortified houſe legate reſides good high broad wall behind eſpecially turret year publick conſiſtory tranſlated council baſil though approved place thence ferrara ſaid greek mind join church rome choſen city meet preſidents council baſil urgent greek exhort prayer promiſes would leave eugenius come content ſo onely braggd would depoſe eugenius would come thither alſo eugenius could tell ſome time yet ſent thither legate one john francis capiteliſta lawyer knight padua plead cauſe sigiſmund emperor dead whoſe favour council baſil flouriſhd albert duke auſtria choſen room cardinal croſſes began council ferrara name eugenius eugenius alſo went thither heard emperor conſtantinople whoſe name john paleologus coming great many gallies well venetian eugeniuss ſake ſent meet emperor leſt violence ſhould offerd becauſe account certain french gallies ſent council archipelago order either bring emperor could ſo leaſt ſhould keep going ferrara eugenius ſo far corrupted admiral thoſe galley money left council baſil came party emperour came ferrara entertaind eugenius roman emperours uſed treated viteleſchus quieted church dominion puniſhd ſeveral prieſts pilferd certain jewel head peter paul apoſtles lateran church belongd put james galeſius accomplice death attempting make innovation upon government went
