surio eugenius deſiring unite two church ſo long different opinion year 1438 made ſolemn prayer celebrated maſs holy ghoſt went council along emperour patriarch conſtantinople emperour ſeated throne ſuitable dignity greek place oppoſite pope queſtion firſt askd whether latin greek ſo long different opinion willing united one church cryd would willingly provided difference firſt reconciled reaſon order diſputations every day thoſe latin greek choſen debate thoſe weighty point happening plague ferrara continued good ſafe ſtaying therefore council removed florence ſoon came thither picenninus preſently took poſſeſſion forli imola ravenna bologna command philip deſign thwart eugeniuss intention friend florentine venetian enemy came back parma raiſing great body horſe paſſed po took ſhort time greater caſal platina native country venetian cremona routed gattamelata general venetian army calvatoni prince mantoua ally beſieged breſcia ſome month ſtoutly defended citizen one francis barbar learned man chief magiſtrate whereupon paſsd thence ſeize ſeveral caſtles thereabout hinder proviſions brought city plundering deſtroying country far verona vincenza ſo left venetian nothing live upon yet accompliſhd without great damage men eſpecially dead winter time took likewiſe ſecured great part river menzo adige lago di garda lago iſeo nothing might carried way water needy inhabitant fitting ſome ship removed adige lago di andreas careened lago di garda near forboli gave venetian ſome reſpite ſeeing nevertheleſs picenninus preſsd thoſe verona vincenza hard venetian thought themſelves quite loſt get good commander therefore ſent james donatus florence league em deſire florentine regard republick venice ſafety liberty italy general would ſend francis sfortia immediately force venice almoſt ruined arm philip mantuan florentine concernd danger well ally perſuade francis take arm venetian promiſed name city defend town belongd church rome greateſt deſire alſo got letter apoſtolical eugenius much ado declare francis marquis lord ancona theſe word let take devil give luck francis going cavalry along coaſt adriatick sea fell ferrara paſſing po boat augmented army padua ſaid twelve thouſand horſe five thouſand foot met enemy firſt suave near verona fought ſmartly ſome time neither better ont afterward picenninus reaſon indiſpoſition want men gave way power francis recoverd caſtles vincenza verona raiſe siege breſcia ſeeing avenue ſtoppd paſſed adige marching part trent went archo town mind take becauſe earl archo ally philip picenninus alſo came thither aſſiſt earl fighting eagerly cautiouſly uſed deſerted reſt army receiving great damage fain fly neighbouring vallies taken enemy charles gonzaga ſon john francis come ſo ſaved imminent danger yet taken afterward foe gathering ſtrength carried priſoner verona write picenninus ſo weakend one ſide wound receivd ſeveral battels able ride back army wrappd sack dead ſo carried upon luſty fellow ſhoulders even enemy camp whilſt theſe thing tranſacted venice philip taking ill florentine help perſuaſion eugenius ſent francis sfortia aid venetian treated thoſe council baſil cite eugenius em twice thrice anſwer expectation ſo far infatuated depoſed eugenius choſe amadeus duke savoy fatherinlaw lived like hermit ripalia ſome nobleman pope called felix hence aroſe great sedition church god chriſtendom divided three part ſome followd eugenius ſome felix reſt neuter eugenius dejected held frequent aſſemblies diſputations greek latin till laſt came reſult greek convincd holy ghoſt proceed father son homuſius ſame ſubſtance come forth father onely formerly believd ought conſecrate body chriſt unleavend bread made wheat believe purgatory laſtly pope rome chriſts true vicar lawful succeſſor saint peter eaſtern well weſtern church ought ſubmit univerſal patriarch buſineſs thus ſetled greek went away armenian alſo agreed u faith error confuted eugeniuss letter purpoſe promulgated ſhew reaſon accorded inſcription given holy general council held florence cathedral novemb 22 1439 done contrived ſtrengthen himſelf ſame time weaken council baſil making eighteen cardinal publick conſiſtory number two greek wit rutenus nicenus greek might kept faith example authority yet nation fell back little time old state others peter barbo siſters son alouiſius patavinus afterward made patriarch aquilegia chamberlain advanced francis condelmerius vicechancelourſhip whilſt theſe thing acted near trent people thought picenninus prince mantoua would yield laſt received ſuch damage removed thence ſpeed verona took help ladder wherewith ſcald wall enterd cittadelle unknown sentinel avoid extream cold north wind night boiſterous quitted poſts got tent francis sfortia heard verona taken enemy marchd thither preſently army recover knowing venetian ſtill poſſeſſion old caſtle fort felix mount therefore enterd city way army ran upon enemy mighty ſhout philip men met horſe force yet come fought ſharply part city call iſland laſt fain yield many picenninus mantuans betook themſelves new bridg call ſome time bore ſhock enemy horſe engaging great many crowded little room drawbridg broke weight men horſes almoſt fell river drownd becauſe tired faſting ſo long ſunk weight arm thereupon francis flying bridg boat put men drove picenninus mantuan diſtruſted citizen fidelity quite city within four day taken philip might draw francis venetian infeſting florentine given ſame pay venetian ſent picenninus tuſcany ſix thouſand horſe midſt winter florentine ſeeing ſent preſently piergianpaulo excellent commander deſired eugenius would aſſiſt em according league bound defend tuſcany ſo reſolvd meet picenninus found john viteleſchus conſpired philip though time legate general churchforces would prove friend pretended came tuſcany enemy head ſix thouſand horſe would fight againſt florentine picenninuss ſide magiſtrates florence contrived real feigned letter matter eugenius killd anthony ridius governour caſtel angelo juſt men paſſing bridg ſo could aided thoſe gone bridg therefore alone becauſe brought reer count averſus fought patriarch loſt general conveyd carriage along roncillione florentine freed ſo great terrour deal cunningly eugenius let lewis padua ſucceeded viteleſchus muſter churchforces come aſſiſtance lewis politick man ſuppoſed mean viteleſchus taken picenninus marching vale mugello killd plunderd far fieſole turning toward caſtentino aſſiſtance count popio made many town revolt thence going perugia went quietly city ſent legat governour pope eugenius upon certain meſſage mean time took treaſurer alterd whole state city choſe ten citizen power life death reſt perugians fearing leſt ſhould ſet tyranny upon bargaind depart city fifty thouſand pound ſo went cortona hoping take place treachery plot diſcoverd conſpirators either killd baniſhd upon marchd citta di caſtello florentine alſo moved aughiera town dominion help countryman picenninus ſhould offer em violence theſe thing paſsd tuſcany whilſt francis sfortia conquerd philip navy lago di garda italiano furlano admiral onely raiſed siege breſcia bergamo ſame summer vanquiſhd philip army soncino taken one thouſand five hundred horſe ſhort time took ſubdud caſtles breſcia part cremona mantoua gerradadua made tributary venetian time prince mantoua loſt aſola lonato peſcheria three town good bigneſs without oppoſition picenninus abſent never durſt engage enemy open field picenninus hearing ſtate affair alterd venice ſent many meſſengers letter well philip prince mantoua alſo tired importunity soldier moſt em native part italy near alp removed camp cita di caſtello borgo di sancto sepolcro town territory lie againſt angliera deſign either compulſion ſtratagem fight florentine pope army lay told near angliera 29 june peter paul day picenninus ſet army array took plain four thouſand pace unfortunately forcd chooſe diſadvantageous place fight becauſe underſtood common soldier enemy gone foraging willing loſe opportunity go ſide hill ſo enemy upon higher ground eaſily kept yet fought five hour ſmartly till laſt picenninus multitude enemy folly son francis forſaken poſt overcome retreated borgo great damage loſs enſigns next day leaving borgo hand townſmen ſome soldier ſurvived battel went back romagna philip townſmen borgo fearing might hardly dealt withal becauſe revolted pope employd agent get pardon ſurrenderd themſelves legat without loſs limb good victory welcom eugenius florentine ſay aloniſius patavinus made cardinal reaſon ſame summer florentine beat count poppio picenninuss ally tuſcany philip environd ſo many enemy fought forein aid entreated alphonſo got poſſeſſion kingdom naples ſtorm town sfortians kingdom draw francis sfortia venetian alphonſo complyd requeſt never could recal francis war engaged ſufficient quantity forage came marchd peſcheria breſcia fifteen thouſand horſe ſix thouſand foot met picenninus cignano deſign fight picenninus willing fight though leſs number men yet ſtout fellow relyd upon valour fought briskly ſome time parted upon equal term francis thinking gotten honour enough war challenged enemy field lead army round country retook ſeveral town picenninus taken winter made ſubject venetian thence went martinengo picenninus fortified ſtrong garriſon beſieged picenninus augmented army arrival francis son prince mantoua went thither pitchd camp mile enemy provoking skirmiſhes come decide matter ſet battel deſiring fight enemy field grew wholly intent upon taking town picenninus therefore removed camp every day ſo much nearer enemy put francis ſuch dangerous circumſtances neither soldier could forrage proviſions ſent army march place without apparent danger juſt beyond hope peace declared agitation philip francis mediation one euſebiolus ſurnamed chain without picenninuss knowledg picenninus heard exclaimd heaven earth philip inconſtancy certain victory deſired peace like conquerd perſon army departing peace declared capriana year 1442 upon theſe term francis ſhould marry blanch daughter philip dowry pontremoli cremona country belonging except picigitono caſtles mantouan pallavicini poſſeſsd thoſe place philip ally taken alſo venetian confederate except aſola lonato peſcheria prince mantouas war ſhould reſtored would accept theſe article ſhould lookd upon common enemy eugeneus likd peace becauſe francis neglected whilſt talkd reſtoring loſt without mentioning bologna picenninus poſſeſſion wherefore reſolvd go florence rome adviſe concerning recovery church patrimony becauſe place might take freedom might find thing quiet ſent alouiſius patavinus cardinal laurence put secular reſtore canon regular lateran expelled secular prieſts upon controverſie em ſhould carry body chriſt upon corpus chriſti day proceſſion gino albaneſe excellent soldier put death becauſe would broken peace eugenius alphonſo palus lamolara alſo ſtout man whoſe part jealous alſo put death thing ſetled manner eugenius came rome september 28 1443 though florentine could keep met city veneration imaginable lay night porta del popolo next day going peter prayer cuſtom walkd pontifical robe city heard people mutiny tax doubled new impoſt laid upon wine thereupon commanded ſilence preſence em aboliſhd exaction tyrannical immediately cryd long live eugenius whereas cryd theſe new gabells inventor nineteen day went lateran declared would hold general council ſent letter meſſengers acquaint ſeveral prince deſign mind weaken deſtroy council baſil mean thing thus compoſed rome rememberd injury receivd ſent picenninus general againſt anconeſes francis ſubdud going bologna toward perugia made thoſe tiferno ally floretines revolt gratifie eugenius angry florentine ſupplying francis mony oppoſe keep ancona alphonſo year long beſieged naples laſt commonſhore got town taken beating rené anjou ſo far taken ſame courage picenninus onely choſe general army honour adopted family aragon ſoon receivd money eugenius alphonſo defray war went ancona reduced many town church francis sfortia come thither good army cremona vainly ſtrove defend time john francis gonzaga dyd venetian florentine concernd time come made lewis gonzaga son heir john francis stipendiary occaſion might oppoſe philip mean time thing pretty quiet thoſe part italy lie next alp hannibal bentivoglio kept priſoner ſometime caſtle pelegrini command picenninus ſuſpicion conſpiracy eſcaped went back bologna excited people liberty ſeizd francis picenninus governour city men done recalld exile whether contrary faction eſpecially one baptiſta canedolus name bolognians ſent embaſſadours venetian florentine deſire alliance embaſſadours obteind returned home preſently took caſtle yet enemy hand help thoſe recruit ſent em friend ſoon taken deſtroyd chaſing alouiſius vermis bologna philip taking ill bolognians ſhould league venetian florentine hired ſome friend baptiſta promiſing aſſiſtance take hannibal themſelves faction might ſole governours city canedolus ready roguery prevailed certain man bologna son accidentally newly born chooſe hannibal godfather next day child carried chriſtend father child invited hannibal john church becauſe john day hannibal complyd traitor thinking deſign way thither ſet upon company conſpirators got ſlain though two servant loved could defend people bologna knew ſo concernd indignity preſently took arm killd chief canedolian faction particularly baptiſta whoſe body draggd city buried ignominiouſly ſame time alſo happend great piece villany acted rome angellottus cardinal mark deprived life money ſo covetouſly gathered ſcraped together valet de chamber villain taken torturd death cut four part hangd upon four gate city venetian florentine fearing leſt bologna commodiouſly ſeated em time war ſhould fall philip hand ſent immediately ſome troop thither aſſiſt venetian gueſs philip deſigned ſend picenninus thither army requeſt exile dyd could ſet ſay dyd grief son francis left behind ancona cardinal firmanus legat vanquiſhd francis sfortia year philip took courage adviſed eugenius endeavour recovery bologna promiſing ſupply men bear ſhare charge war pope ſo wrought upon made league alphonſo ſent sigiſmund malateſta great body horſe ancona againſt francis florentine otherwiſe imployd bologna might forced ſurrender philip ſent william montferrat charles gonzaga great army entering territory bologna hoſtile manner plunderd em florentine concernd danger ally diſpatchd aſtorgius faventinus one thouſand five hundred horſe two hundred foot aid bolognians till farther order venetian thing ſtood thus romagna philip ſudden ſent francis picenninus ancona gave order go great army upon may day againſt cremoneſes apprehended ſuch thing went commanded took great many country fellow ſtrook ſuch terrour citizen battering wall night day near taken city venetian florentine troubled danger francis friend reſolvd defend cremona bologna ſame time ſent tibertus brandolinus active commander taking along bologneſes auxiliary florence marchd toward enemy well agree among themſelves encampd town calld st john brought william monferrat bolognians promiſes preſents eaſily routed charles quickly retrieved town enemy hand bologna thus quieted auxiliary florence venice divided order two part one half ſent avoid francis sfortia eugenius alphonſo beaten far wall ʋrbino▪ half cremoneſes hard put francis picenninus venetian reſolving upon open rupture philip ſent embaſſadours denounce war unleſs would deſiſt siege cremona anſwerd meſſenger could ſpeak philip himſelf might ſafer millain venetian angry commanded michelot cotignola general breſcia march forthwith cremona philip got moſt part engage enemy wherever met readily obeyd command paſſing river oglio caſale expedition found enemy encamped upon po iſland forded attackd camp ſoon routed taking great part cavalry recoverd town freed cremona siege augmented army lewis gonzagas additional force reduced platina ſome caſtles cremona venetian marchd toward geradada left nothing philip crema croſſing river entred millain filling place fire rapine taken monte di briauſa brevio bridg adda attaqued leco thoſe within ſtoutly defended batterd ship ſo ſeverely whole men might got ſides em ſo loſt many men great want forage fain depart without accompliſhing deſign fear francis sfortia heard privately gone philip party mean time aloiſius patavinus pope legat general force went againſt francis sfortia ancona hearing italiano james gatuano fought partly philip partly eugenius revolting francis commanded taken could arrive put death em one thouſand five hundred horſe francis sfortia much concernd finding himſelf able ſuſtein ſhock enemy longer ſet upon ſo many time aſſiſted body perſuaſions eugenius alphonſo▪ envied venetian ſucceſs left ancona went philip army made general eugenius leſt ſhould ſeem mind reſolution venerable aſpect rather grave eloquent speech indifferent scholar though knowing man eſpecially hiſtory bountiful eſpecially learned men whoſe company loved admitted leonard aretinus charles poggius auriſpa trapezuntius blondus learned men secretary eaſily provoked anger injury done calumny jibe ſcoffs great patron school eſpecially rome kind learning taught loved religious wonderfully gave em many priviledges beſides revenue added foundation loved war ſo much man would admire pope beſides told action italy inſtigated dolphin son charles french king firſt made peace king duke burgundy go great body horſe againſt thoſe baſil ſo routed aſſembly afterward ſent ʋladiſlaus king poland along julian caeſarinus againſt turk thirty thouſand ſlain one battel adrianople danube though king indeed himſelf cardinal killd ſame time accounted ſtrict word unleſs promiſed thing better revoke perform kept good houſe yet lived ſpare diet himſelf ſo great ſtranger wine properly called abſtemious familiar friend learned men whoſe counſel made uſe great matter uſed admit chamber suppertime witneſſes ſober converſation would ask em news city people thought government ſince pope might correct errour ought amiſs either perſon body elſe endeavoured adorn church building chappels appears pope chappel brazen door peter church dyd told done many great action ſixty fourth year age buried peter church marble tomb upon theſe verſes eugenius jacet hic quartas cor nobile cujas teſtantur vitae ſplendida facta ſuae iſtius ante ſacros ſe praebuit alter ab ortu alter ab occaſa caeſar uterque pes alter ut accipiat fidei documenta latinae alter ut aurato cingat honore caput quo duce armenii graiorum exempla fecuti romanam agnorunt aethiopeſque fidem inde siri ac arabes mundique è finibus indi magna ſed haec animo c • ncta minora ſu • nam valida rurſum teucros jam claſſe petebat dum petit aſt ill • ſuſtulit atra dy qui ſemper vanos tumuli contemp • honores atque hac impreſſa condita dixit humo sed non quem rubro decoraverat ille galero non hoc franciſcus ſtirps ſua clara tulit suſceptique memor meriti tàm nobile quod nunc cernis tàm praeſtans ſurgere juſſit opus death seat vacant twelve day nicolas v nicolas fifth formerly called thomas sarzana town territory lucca choſen pope general conſent march 6 1447 though man mean extract mother name andreola father bartholomew phyſician yet worthy pontificate virtue learning courteſie good nature liberality magnificence notwithſtanding ſo modeſt thought himſelf undeſerving ſo great honour deſired cardinal take better care church god cardinal tarento exhorted reſiſt holy ghoſt ſubmitted ſhoulders burthen took upon cardinal portugal askd ti uſual coming conclave made pope anſwerd chooſe nicolas god ſay thomas born piſa brought lucca made scholar bologna eſpecially philoſophy divinity learnd nicolas albergate cardinal croſs extreamly pleaſed youth ingenuity part reaſon popedom aſſumed name nicolas becauſe name one deſervd well gaind degree univerſity probation moſt acute controverſies cardinal croſs made steward houſhold clerk penitentiary till got pontifical subdeaconſhip good life converſation people admired began think greater matter eugenius knew learning integrity eſpecially diſputations greek florence ferrara time deſignd cardinal might better pretenſions ſent germany along john carvagialla afterward cardinal angelo diſſolve council baſil neutrality german called neuter becauſe would obey neither felix eugenius mean church god ſufferd greatly papacy loſt ſomething grandieur frequent meeting diſpute point frederick king roman perſuaſions aeneas picolhomineus afterward pope time secretary king indeed found hard remove german opinion though altogether falſe ſide difficult induce eugeniuss agent comply german propoſals laſt agent mollified requeſts german moderated certainly put end schiſm neutrality ſo pernicious sea rome german would ſtood promiſe legats went back eugenius opinion made cardinal general agreement eugenius ſent hat whilſt yet porta del popolo might come greater honour city thus one ſame year thomas got biſhop bologna cardinal pope great ſatisfaction clergy people rome yet cardinal conclave ſmall buſtle city inſtigation stephen porcaro roman knight eloquent ingenious man calling companion church called ara coeli encouraged em aſſert liberty ſaid every petit town lord dead usd talk liberty leaſt limiting power governours nothing done purpoſe becauſe archbiſhop benevento vicechamberlain againſt roman alſo feared king alphonſo ſtayd tivoli eugenius dead doubt himſelf whether ſhould go back make war againſt florentine eugenius philip formerly deſign whilſt deliberated two sieneſes got living ſetting people together ear perſuaded attempt government tuſcany might eaſily obtain maſter siena would ſurrender ſelf upon arrival king commended sieneſes ſending away ſolicite fellowcitizens promiſed ſuch time nicolas pope lover peace quietneſs kept coronation faſhion made many proceſſions foot perſon ſent cardinal morinenſis ferrara place neutral fit treaty perſuaſion authority legat faction might induced compoſure thither alſo alphonſa philip venetian florentine ſend embaſſadours long debate gave philip leave chooſe whether would make truce venetian florentine five year ſides keeping had▪ conclude peace change crema thoſe town venetian taken upon river adda leaving onely caſſan pope diſpoſal due compact make amends injury firſt received alſo afterward thrown make peace laſting one philip embaſſadours ſent make propoſal found dead apoplexy day came millain auguſt 8 1447 morinenſis hearing philip death ſent embaſſadours haſte houſe urgd peace earneſtly ever venetian askd would continue former opinion made anſwer could tell might philip dead would write senate concerning affair ſhould order mean time embaſſadours knowing venetian ambition govern italy diſſolvd aſſembly went every one home pope legat exhorting concord vain venetian whoſe camp sorefina near cremona hope take tumultuous city ſurrender help guelphs heard philip death marchd preſently lody taken receivd thoſe piacenza alliance upon ſame term lodi ſent one thouſand five hundred horſe thither immediately aſſiſt people piacenza body ſhould moleſt em francis sfortia time beaten ancona quartered bologna refreſh army whoſe arm horſes men almoſt ſpent long war heard venetian ſeizd upon fatherinlaws death went great day journey till came cremona choſen general univerſal conſent millaineſes force againſt venetian made bridg river po fortified caſtles artillery hinder venetian coming navy piacenza paſſed adda picigitono encampd far enemy lay camurago ſome light skirmiſhes try ſuppoſe enemy courage people pavia ſo much encouraged franciss coming ſo glad ſee becauſe hated ſubject millaineſes upon old grudg hand would rather ſuffer thing ſubmit venetian formerly deſpiſed alliance inſomuch deliverd city francis without ado conſent governour caſtle ſuch addition grandieur sfortia preſently affected lord whole dutchy millain theſe thing paſſed lombardy thereabouts whilſt alphonſo ſame time fell army seacoaſt siena ſubdued though pope againſt florentine knew king intention ſent meſſenger siena adviſe alphonſo covetous dominion leſs enemy florentine sieneſes hearing danger deny king kind proviſions yet would ſuffer soldier come within wall king obſervd caution marchd volaterra piſa took many caſtles partly ſurrender partly ſtorm yet florentine recoverd long caſtiglione command sigiſmund malateſta corrupted come alphonſo ſide mean time nicolas pope continually perſuaded king venetian peace rather war grown proud unruly would hearken good advice thereupon francis raiſed great army main ſtrength italy uniting brachian sfortian soldier pitchd camp middle autumn piacenza good garriſon venetian beating part wall cannon ſtayd ſo long till po roſe prodigious heighth galeoones came wall ſo attacking land water laſt took plunderd great honour francis take ſo great city wintertime rained ſo hard soldier ready leave tent yet nicolas even ſtill talking peace florentine urgent ally venetian becauſe feard king power army tuſcany nothing done becauſe venetian unwilling reſtore lodi millaineſes earneſtly ſought nicolas ſo many attempt purpoſe laid aſide thought making peace ſuch mean applying himſelf religious exerciſes orderd day humiliation kept appeaſing god anger prayer peace chriſtendom solemnity pope himſelf aſſiſted clergy proceſſion peter mark great piety religion wrath god abated ſo much men probably deſerved two year ſuch plague almoſt place ſurvived great number calamity foretold frequent earthquake eclipſe sun nay often foretold frier predicants eſpecially one robert franciſcan famous preacher ſo moved people rome sermon woman child ran city deſiring god merciful unto leaſt misfortune ſhould lacking italy war told begun ſo increaſe one would thought impoſſible put end francis sfortia next summer taken ſome caſtles venetian went land seaforces againſt navy blockd cremoneſes forced retire caſal thither alſo followd cannon diſabled ship lay harbour driving admiral venice ſuch deſpair burnd navy could keep ran town faſt could francis went thence took farther care cremona deſtroyd enemy navy marchd toward geradada encampd caravagio well fortified enemy venetian moved thither fearing ſhould loſe reputation millaineſes took town therefore lay mile enemy ſhewd townſmen occaſion would come aſſiſt skirmiſhes every day ſo near one another came joyn battel happend narrow way ſurrounded fen vanguard venetian ſo ſtraightend could give back ſometimes war may convenient yet fight enemy came ſo thick upon inſomuch muſt neceſſity periſhd reer begun run away francis purſud em gave ground onely made himſelf maſter wealthy camp took five thouſand horſe foot brachians without francis conſent ordered millaineſes attaque lodi moved toward breſcia army beſieged ſo alarmd venetian concluded themſelves loſt make peace francis quarrel millaineſes peace make upon condition joyning force againſt millaineſes ſhould take beyond river adda po ſhould franciss ſide adda ſhould venetian ſhould allow florentine venetian betwixt em ſixteen thouſand pound month ſend aid ſtill till got poſſeſſion millain made league drawn commander could ſide promiſes preſents turnd toward millaineſes took moſt city ſurrender ſucceſs venetian ſo concernd ſaw fortune much better expected took crema according agreement recalling soldier made peace millaineſes fearing power francis got millain francis pretended kindneſs venetian aſſiſted ſupplyd coſmo di medicess private pocket treaſury florence long tedious siege many bloody skirmiſhes middle winter though ſome men forſook joined enemy alphonſo againſt claimed millain birthright therefore kept lewis gonzaga pay ſent againſt bolognians men might paſs ſafety lombardy laſt took millain year 1449 ti true venetian aſſiſt millaineſes conduct sigiſmund malateſta join picenninus fought millaineſes ſuch lame rate famiſhd yielded city rather venetian francis wherefore venetian ſeeing thing went quite contrary expectation treated alphonſo utter enemy francis made league rout ambitious man millain grew ſtrong alſo ſollicited florentine ſame ſaid would never againſt francis therefore venetian baniſhd merchant dominion prevailed alphonſo like nicolas pope ſeeing italy arm often interpoſe authority make peace people might come next year freely europe jubilee fiftieth year acoming wherein jubilee celebrated uſual manner beſides made ſix cardinal number latinus ʋrſinus brother mother ſide called philip cardinal laurence lucina good man generous diſpoſition mean time frederick emperour pope requeſt forced felix renounce popedom becauſe ſaw ſubmitted agreement ſo rejoyce onely clergy people rome night heard april 23 1449 rode city flambeau hand cryd long live nicolas pope might ſeem unthankful god ſo extraordinary benefit went publickly soncio adjacent town long took together ſome troop horſe fell hand becauſe francis men ready ſo ſoon ſhould lewis gonzaga friend ally came went breſcia brought venetian ſuch extremity durſt venture fen fight open campaigne reaſon venetian willing protract time placing hope victory delay becauſe thought francis could hold long ſuch charge want money likewiſe hoped millaineſes would think liberty father mother called john francis gentile family gave good education made pope conſent cardinal april 8 1455 firſt education fourteen year old laid foundation learning elſewhere went univerſity lerida attained ſuch perfection ſhort time commenced doctor civil canon law made learned reading thoſe came hear peter luna called benedict xiii accord without asking gave canonſhip church lerida becoming famous learning went alphonſo king aragon made secretary one privy council afterward made governour church majorca friend perſuaded parſon church refuſed ſaid expected biſhop valenza long deſervedly came benedict xiii dead thoſe two anticardinals told life martin made one giles canon barcelona pope room dyd paniſchola called clement eighth alphonſo boria preſently ſent thither king alphonſo agreed martin without apparent danger life well thoſe attended tyrannically paniſchola kept governd thoſe chiefly whoſe intereſt breed diſcord alphonſo made giles ſo ſenſible errour reaſon authority quarterd em give example others warn em never attempt ſo great piece villany againſt rightful lord soon appeared comet ſome day hairy red aſtrologers ſaid portended great plague dearth ſome mighty slaughter calixtus appointed faſt ſeveral day pray god judgment hung would pleaſed avert turn upon turk enemy chriſtianity gave order likewiſe god ſhould ſupplicated every day bell ſhould rung noon give people notice ſhould joyn prayer chriſtians againſt turk chriſtians aſſiſted prayer whole church fought againſt turk belgrade conduct john vaivod excellent perſon john capiſtranus order minor letter meſſengers open eye laſt amidſt ſuch great danger would ſeek remedy vain enemy recruited whilſt good man thinking talking theſe thing james picenninus revolted venetian marchd territory siena numerous body horſe foot demand sieneſes ſome thouſands pound ſaid owd upon father nicolass account formerly fought commiſſion sieneſes fearing worſt ſent prince italy aſſiſt em bound contract eſpecially pope firſt adviſed em give james one farthing ſent force againſt admoniſhd prince italy ſame leſt flame ſhould break italy might fierce quench italian fearing pope word would prove true ſent ſpeedy ſuccours sieneſes onely alphonſo favoured james ſent houſe mindful friendſhip formerly contracted nicolas picenninus father would aſſiſt sieneſes ought done nay ſo far animated count petilian againſt ſeemed chief cauſe miſchief auxiliary came onely francis sfortia venetian alſo picenninus reduced paſs ſome battle routed mightily weakend eſpecially orbitello inſomuch fain take ſhipping alphonſos gallies ſent diſtreſs ſail country without ſucceſs great attempt thus aſſiſtance calixtus ally sieneſes freed great danger though ſtill troubled inteſtine domeſtick well forein broil reaſon ſome citizen contemnd preſent liberty followd alphonſos faction alſo ti thought great war firſt raiſed honeſt citizen turnd killd reſt day retain liberty purchaſed ſo dear rate omit puniſh licentiouſneſs soldier thoſe fled colour gilbert corrigia put death gave men common prey reſt sigiſmund malateſta like ſervd ſame ſauce time fought protracting war driving away cattel ground enemy year happend ſuch earthquake kingdom naples upon ſeventh december many church houſes fell great deſtruction man beaſt eſpecially naples capua cajetta averſa city old campania whoſe ruines ſince ſeen great aſtoniſhment went thither look antiquity alſo alphonſo often repeat vow made againſt turk ſaid would ſhortly perform could never brought holy war ſo mightily taken delight naples calixtus ſetled affair italy created nine cardinal two nephew two siſters wit roderick borgia john miliano siſters son alſo made aeneas biſhop siena cardinal made uſe procure peace italy whilſt sieneſes teazed war earl tagliacocius dead pope made governour city year roſe controverſie neapolio ʋrſin count averſus later poſſeſſion monticello far tivoli pretending belongd daughterinlaw count daughter neapolio urgd ſide ought himſelf reckond ʋrſine family whilſt theſe two contended thus patrimony arm roman people ſufferd greatly controverſie alſo ſides commanded lay arm calixtus made nephew borgia onely governour city room count deceaſed made general churchforces might keep great men city better order alphonſo long dying without lawful heir calixtus courage demand kingdom ſaid belongd sea apoſtolick eſcheat whereupon army raiſed ſides ferdinand alphonſos heir feard calixtuss reſolution knew nature greatneſs soul death alſo put thing confuſion freed ferdinand great conſternation mind calixtus died third year third month ſixteenth day pontificate buried vatican left hand st peter round church dedicated st marie del febri formerly repaired nicolas borgia alſo nephew died long civita vechia whither fled ſave himſelf ʋrſins diſobliged favouring oppoſite faction give ſhort character calixtus upright man commended one thing biſhop cardinal would never keep benefice commendam ſaid content one wife virgin ie church valenza canon law ordains beſides charitable poor chriſtians publick private gave portion ſeveral poor virgin married kept indigent nobleman charge occaſion munificent prince eſpecially thoſe could aſſiſt church chriſt likewiſe ſent lewis bologna order st francis ʋſuncaſſanus prince perſia armenia king tartar many great preſents animate againſt turk perſuaſion enemy great damage ſent embaſſadours deſignd come calixtus dyd pope pius admirable rarity u onely upon account diſtant country whence came habit unuſual ſtrange eye ſay ʋſuncaſſanus many victory enemy wrote pope conquerd foe pope prayer would one day thank kindneſs divine rather humane alliance begun calixtus preſervd day chriſtians prince vexes turk continual war laid little building becauſe dyd ſoon gatherd money could maintain great perillous war againſt turk onely repaird st priſca upon mount aventine alſo city wall broken almoſt ground yet ſome hanging gold bought ſparing diet modeſt diſcourſe acceſſible much age would ſuffer eighty year old yet ſtudious ever either read himſelf heard thoſe whenever important affair would give leave compoſed office transfiguration lord jeſus chriſt orderd ſaid ſame manner ſame indulgence corpus chriſti day ſo much valued receivd embaſſadours came great kindneſs would yield propoſals demand conſiſtent virtue juſtice cauſe fell long quarrel alphonſo ſometimes would ask give biſhopricks ſuch either upon ſcore age ignorance book well men ought calixtus dyd left 115000 l behind heaped together make warlike preparation againſt turk calixtus going cauſe charged u many thing eſpecially diſputed concerning immortality soul held opinion plato auguſtin ſays like chriſtian faith ti good reaſon ſays saint cicero make plato god among philoſophers certainly outwent wit underſtanding therefore choſe diſpute becauſe reaſons concerning laſt end man divine nature better reſt ſays paul diſputing calld god queſtion may objected divine philoſophers diſcipline leo ſays wont done ringleader error deſervedly called heretic according jerom maintaining opinion oppoſition church could give account life youth till time ever ſince came year conveyance ſullage city run tybur repaired many aquaeducts fountain brought brazen statue aurelius obſcure place erected open area capitol reduced vatican library ſuch condition hath made famous world brought book thither part europe left alſo certain rent revenue increaſe penſions alſo librarykeepers underofficers pedeſtal statue library theſe verſes written templa domum expoſitis vicos forum maenia pons virgineam trivii quod reparatis aquam priſc licet nautis statuas dare commoda portus et vaticanum cingere chriſte jugum plus tamen urbs debet nam quae ſqualore latebat cernitur celebri bibliotheca loco ſhort nothing tended glory ornament city neglected ſuch zeal power defence privilege church would never ſuffer infringed prince offer injury indignity return due revenge inſtance appears war made confederacy venice genoua againſt duke ferrara ally managed ſo much heat venetian made ſeparate peace without conſent approbation ſo highly reſented brought fit gout increaſed violence died thereof 13th auguſt 1484 held pontifical sea ſpace 13 year four day arrived age 70 year 22 day death diſtick made siſtere qui nullo potuit cum foedere sixtus audito tantum nomine pacis obit body interred peter church monument braſs julian cardinal lien cauſed erected highaltar chair vacant 16 day innocent viii sixtʋs dead cardinal entered vatican ſpace 16 day deceaſe former pope elected john baptiſta cibo cardinal balbina ſucceed papal chair native genoua born illuſtrious family year 1432 father knight count empire senator rome lived long time family service ferdinand king naples afterwards coming rome received family cardinal bologna brother pope nicolas v created biſhop savona paul ii melfy prieſt cardinal title balfina sixtus iv whoſe deceaſe common ſuffrages 24 cardinal elected pope 29th auguſt 1484 crowned francis piccolomini calling himſelf name innocent eighth inauguration uſed theſe word ego autem innocentia mea ingreſſus ſum tho guiccardin allow motto correſpond manner onufrius ſaith often covered avarice covetous deſires drollery ſome pleaſant expreſſions howſoever ſtiled moſt writer honorable character pious affable commended ſanctity life profound learning firſt buſineſs took hand came papal chair take excommunication pope sixtus laid venetian himſelf perfect amity maintaining fair correſpondence chriſtian prince endeavoured ſo reconcile one another united ſtrict confederacy might convert arm againſt turk become formidable common enemy chriſtendom tho naturally averſe war yet zeal chriſtian religion moved equippe fleet coſt expence 150 thouſand crown ſucceſsful enterpriſe gained great renown eſteem chriſtian prince alſo improved various good office • nd act juſtice performed towards rebleſſed venetian deſecrated attainted excommunication sixtus eaſed church burden extraordinary tax retrenched many ſuperfluous charge family conferred many benefit favour privilege order francis auguſtin dominick thundered montorio great repute popular city aquila together city abruzzo recourſe pope ſanctuary proteſting caſe would receive protection ſhould forced yield reſign themſelves hand power ſome forein prince poſitively refuſe accept propoſals inclinable unconcerned spectator actor hazardous war charles entered italy marched victorious thro lombardy overthrown army florence ſoon became maſter city ſelf thence proceeded towards rome entered firſt january 1494 without oppoſition agreed caſe roman would peaceably open gate give free admiſſion french hurt violence ſhould offered inhabitant contrary made new pope created day cardinal amboiſe archbiſhop rouen ſupported intereſt france power borgia ſeemed ſtand faireſt election french force withdrawn engage spaniard campagna rome greateſt tho beſt number cardinal agreed election 21 day september 1503 choſe francis piccolomini cardinal siena pope renew memory pius second uncle took upon name pius third ſolemnly crowned 8th october following sea vacant ſix month three day ceſar borgia election remained army nepe ſo ſoon received intelligence pope created returned rome attended 150 men arm like number horſemen 800 foot paid reverence obeyſance pope returned thanks college cardinal elected perſon ſo wiſe ſo religious good ſo worthy papal chair borgia performed ceremony took lodging vatican ʋrſini thirſty revenge aſſaulted armed force valiantly defending himſelf many killed ſides length borgia order pope better ſecurity ſent caſtle angelo whence without licenſe pope liberty go abroad people forſaking lying fear fortune led theſe trouble perſon aged ſick pope haſtned accompliſhment day ſo expired laſt breath 18th october 1503 26th day election without ſome ſuſpicion poiſon ſore leg imagined ſuggeſtion contrivance pandolfo petrucci tyrant siena ſome poiſon injected wound thereby greatly afflicted ſpeedily brought end aged 74 year 5 month 10 day afterwards buried chappel andrew belonging peter church fair monument marble near sepulchre uncle sea vacant 14 day jʋliʋs ii funeral obſequies pope pius performed firſt night cardinal entered conclave 9th day october julian de la rovere biſhop cardinal oſtia elected pope common conſent 37 suffrage ſo unanimouſly concurring together choice report fixed concentred upon afterwards gave himſelf name julius second born savona within dominion genoua father name raphael brother sixtus fourth whoſe pedigree already mentioned two brother bartholomew frier order francis biſhop ferrara patriarch antioch john prefect rome duke sora senegaglia himſelf biſhop carpentras ſame time peter riario created cardinal peter ad vincula ſaid sixtus fourth obtained dignity julius appeared extremely grave modeſt action ſo acquired good eſteem opinion perſons obliging thoſe one moſt eminent captain world manner truce abſolutely broken moſt cruel war began italy imperialiſts entering eccleſiaſtical state ſome skirmiſhes pope force froſolone matter preſſing hard diſadvantage french king intreated make diverſion attempting ſubjection kingdom naples hereupon determined invade naples sea land monſieur de vaudemont ancient right king rené laid claim kingdom ſucceſſes many trouble deſolations italy pope wanting mony grew weary war diſappointed french king great promiſes little performance always failed time payment neither complied ſupplies men mony ducat imperial army whatſoever taken church kingdom naples family colonna ſhould made good rendered pompeo colonna ſhould reſtored dignity cardinal abſolved eccleſiaſtical cenſures condition grievous day time news accord made known duke bourbon army soldiery became enraged duke raiſed infinite difficulty ſtanding agreement eſpecially spaniſh soldiery ſo violent therein gentleman ſent viceroy duke parent chriſtian king therefore would never give ear thoſe ſuggeſtions french miniſters faction would frequently inculcate favour king whereas former pope always averſe inſtances emperor french king prince made general council held reforming abuſes crept church ſuppreſſing opinion luther called heretical began dilate ſpread themſelves part chriſtendom paul third ſuch different ſenſe herein prevention plot deſigns againſt ſend diego de mendoza cardinal granvel embaſſadors place arrived preſſed pope legate proceed buſineſs time might conſumed purpoſe legate endeavouring evade ſtill put delay impediment way ſo diſpleaſing emperor miniſters proteſted againſt thoſe delatory excuſes legate giving anſwer granvel recalled ſent reſide diet noremberg opened beginning year 1543 ſo nothing expedition emperor forced riſe retire thence midnight villaco dukedom auſtria confines italy mean duke became maſter oenepont place diſtant three day journey trent regard ſucceſſes war various preſent error abuſes crept church diſſolute corrupt manner clergy conſider mean correct reform whileſt attended theſe matter found themſelves ſo engulfed immersd difficulty paſt wiſedom redreſs sacrament kind threatning want thereof ſeize eſtates take away life many debate diver subject ſeveral congregation length day seſſion came 16th july decree read four canon confirmed anathema thereunto annexed firſt faithful laiety obliged command communicate kind secondly church upon good ground reaſons taken away cup laiety thirdly whoſoever receives bread onely receives jeſus chriſt fully intirely end purpoſes ſpiritual grace salvation fourthly communion neceſſary infant impertinent queſtion demanded namely whether ſuch ſatisfied herewith might receive sacrament kind deſired wherefore pope party cardinal arrived rome received joy honour imaginable lodged pope palace immediately perſon viſited complement never pope made character cardinal paſſed ſuch kindneſs ſeveral private conference pope ſeemed refuſe nothing might engage oblige cardinal inſtance granted alienation church three hundred thouſand liver year king france bene formerly demanded ſollicited great importunity could never obtained endearment happened cardinal pope mutual intimacy friendſhip began ſo great pope opened boſom heart giving underſtand council become burden could ſupport therefore ſent private unleſs diverted war flanders ſailed rendezvouz corfu towards end july 15721572 arrived corfu joyning foſcarini general venetian compoſed conſiderable fleet conſiſting one hundred thirty gallies ſix galleaſſes ten ship eſteemed themſelves ſufficient ſtrength encounter turk whoſe force notwithſtanding late defeat reported conſiſt two hundred fifty sail moſt part veſſels built haſte framed green unſeaſoned timber notwithſtanding number eſteemed inferiour force wellbuilt equipped fleet chriſtians confidence reſolved attaque turk anchoring coaſt mavoiſia chriſtians come near cerigo weighed anchor ſight turk capomalio upon ʋzun hali captain paſha turk armata adventuring ſtand ſhock ſo well compoſed ſo well ordered force turned ſtern gallies enemy rowed weſtward directing courſe iſle cervi chriſtians mean time toaing heavier veſſels purſued ſo ſlowly night came arrived within ſhot enemy time ʋzun hali putting good face buſineſs intended engage hope night would ſoon ſeparate turned prow gallies enemy obſerved coming heat valour tacked baſely put himſelf flight rowed away ſo hard chriſtians able overtake returned cerigo remained ſpace two day returned purſuit turk 10th auguſt unto king alſo cardinal bourbon archbiſhop lion complices true ſaid would beſt become righteouſneſs judgment king proceeded juditiary way according method rule law cardinal aſſiſted power brother authority two potent prelate become ſtrong law treated uſual formality common proceſs forced king abandon palace fly diſguiſe ſtreets paris remained mild term accommodation either king muſt become theſe reaſons yet gentle ſubmiſſive term ambaſſadours abated fury anger appeared countenance replyed loud voice well aſſured gondi diſpatched errand thing ſaid judgment made ſorrow repentance king crime committed ſuch obedience profeſſed apoſtolical sea ſo long contrary priviledges thereof detained prelate priſon caſe expected abſolution ſeek tear perſon expreſs employed purpoſe ought seſſion prelate thereupon conſider whether ſuch repentance real unfeigned laſt concluded theſe ſharp word ſaid think ſome poor ſimple frier unacquainted men world ſhall find sixtus ready expend blood defence paolina publick scrutiny cardinal common unanimous vote elected pope ſaid choice kneeled altar inſtead ſhewing joy sixtus v others betrayed let full abundance tear ſeeming filled great fear confuſion aſſent mouth others told conſent could recorded word others onely wherefore thus urged abundance tear expreſſed himſelf manner lord god ſeeſt heart men ſecrets hid knoweſt preſent come election thou haſt made thy vicar earth ſhall thy glory ſervice good thy faithful people grant beſeech thee tongue may cleave root mouth ʋt lingua mea adhaereat faucibus mei thou thy providence doſt foreſee ſhall violator eccleſiaſtical liberty according deſire holineſs cauſed law antient modern relating point controverſie reviewed examined find nothing hath eſtabliſhed power supreme prince leaſt derogatory papal authority apparent duty secular magiſtrate inſpect conſider kind company fit admitted city edifice fit erected may time prove hurtful publick ſafety regard dominion venice doth abound church religious houſes much part convenient erect licenſe build onely granted contribution made thereunto publick liberality munificence ſo neceſſary ſet bound limit thereunto senate made uſe power alone without diminution canon church whereas pope hath power reſtrain clergy alienating land eſtates laiety without conſent diſpenſation ſo alſo hath temporal prince like authority forbid inhibit layperſons making alienation eſtates unto church eccleſiaſtical perſons loſe thing reſtriction rather procure benefit temporal power weakned ſuch alienation state bulwark chriſtendom able withſtand common enemy afford due protection either clergy laiety therefore senate doth believe incurred eccleſiaſtical cenſure conſidering secular prince received power god making law humane authority able take much leſs brief holineſs place prevalence matter purely temporal clearly diſtinct thoſe ſpiritual papal power doth ſingly extend senate imagine holineſs full piety religion perſiſt theſe commination cauſe hath firſt fully examined diſcuſſed thus much thought fit ſhort make known unto holineſs referring thing treated explained large ambaſſadour extraordinary theſe letter senate arrived face whole senate declare cenſures taken make void null though senate ſtill inſiſt innocence never juſtly incurred penalty eccleſiaſtical cenſure yet however judged act prejudice cauſe cardinal declaration admitted though senate would conſent accompany cardinal st mark church maſs ended receive benediction leſt ſhould appear people cenſures taken benediction would tacite confeſſion state nerveſa scipio saraceno canon vicenza secretary made obeyſance ambaſſadour ſaid theſe lord priſoners moſt serene prince according late agreement hath ſent conſigned excellency proteſting howſoever withdrawing room cardinal ſeated ſaid theſe priſoners delivered hand pope ſaid cardinal conſign hand perſon pointing officer claudio montano pope commiſſary ſent end purpoſe touched token ſeizure poſſeſſion deſired miniſters juſtice would pleaſed take care cuſtody matter paſt cardinal ambaſſadour went doge maſs returned college attended signory savii taken seat cardinal entered declared himſelf theſe word rejoyce much ſee moſt happy day greatly deſired declare serene highneſs cenſures church taken reality hereof cannot teſtifie moſt ſenſible ſatisfaction reſpect great benefit chriſtendom italy particular receive thereby doge delivered hand cardinal revocation proteſt form directed prelats proteſt ſent purpoſe whereas expedient mean found make pope ſenſible true candour mind ſincere action republick ſo cauſes removed preſent difference whereas republick hath always endeavoured maintain perfect good underſtanding apoſtolical chair ſo eſpecially remains ſatisfied length obtained moſt juſt deſire thought fit give notice adding farther matter performed ſides moſt equal cenſures taken proteſt alſo revoked evening senate aſſembled choice ambaſſadour ſent rome reſide holineſs perſon elected cavalier contarini company three others formerly employed congratulate pope aſſumption papal chair herewith ended great controverſie pope venetian diſturbed chriſtendom might ruin deſtruction papal authority pope wiſely time made ſenſible thereof granted every thing almoſt venetian required beginning progreſs whole matter may obſerve ſpirit paul v aſpired make himſelf great sixtus v ſeemed follow much way method undertok enterpriſe difficult power errour grounded miſtake better able cope deal republick monarch firſt compoſed diver head humour might ſooner admit diviſion council ſingle perſon many zealous moſt ſuperſtitious religion might affected eccleſiaſtical cenſures terrified excommunication contrary made appear effect moſt evidently ſignalized wiſdom conſtancy republick would never obliged become pliant flexible fire hell damnation pope could threaten indeed farther appears republick opinion cenſures pope invalid eſtabliſhed juſt legal cauſes ſo likewiſe believed could depart leaſt ſcruple temporal power god given without betraying truſt god committed charge herein ſo reſolute conſtant leſt ſhould ſeem acknowledg fault one ſtep late tranſactions would ſo much accept cardinal bleſſing leſt ſhould ſeem given form abſolution controverſie ended hitherto allayed joy contentment pope conceived late exaltation papal dignity venetian purſuance article agreed diſpatched four ambaſſadours rome namely franciſco molino procurator st mark john mocenigo peter dudo franciſco contareno knight senatours chief renown pope received imaginable honour overjoyed put end buſineſs ſo full danger himſelf meaſures failed longer argued defence cauſe entertained ambaſſadours expoſtulations concerning matter paſt little foundation reaſons hiſt jeſuits chief incendiary trouble depart kingdom england return upon pain ſeverity thoſe law made againſt alſo recuſants return home dwelling remain london come within ten mile court without generales inquiſitores adſcriptus et ʋrbis vicarius electus cum omnes tantorum munerum partes summa cum laude obiviſſet ad summum pontificatum leone xi è vivis erepto florens adhuc aetate incredibili help intervention interpreter thus maffeo barberini made many ſteps degree honour prepared himſelf pontifical dignity many service rendered eccleſiaſtical state turn came aſcend unto popedom ſaid gregory deceaſed barberini ſixth auguſt elected pope taking name ʋrban viii applauſe world reaſon high conceit learning ability pope ſoon election fell ſick violent fever cauſed inconveniencies ſuffered conclave unhealthfulneſs air great grief fear people rome extreamly rejoyced election much dejected danger death recovered took motto domino ſperans non infirmabor age fifty five year firſt elected time would retire cloath himſelf pontifical veſtments proſtrated himſelf altar tear earneſtly intreat god caſe according omniſcient providence foreſaw unequal ſo great charge ſhould prove uſeful inſtrument church would rather pleaſed ſtrike dead permit go forth cloath himſelf thoſe hallowed garment would aſcribe glory god ſtamped motto coyn facit mirabilia magna ſolus ſickneſs pope cauſe coronation deferred 29th september feaſt st michael archangel pope commonly taken guardian angel alexander eſte prince cardinal deacon honour plant triple crown upon head time people made loud ſhouts acclamation ʋrban particular devotion st michael erected image angel braſs upon altar sanctum petronella st peter church perſon knee humble poſture theſe word te mane te veſpere becauſe cuſtom pope 19th november go proceſſion vatican st john de lateran performed cuſtom ſuch solemnity beyond uſual one maſcardus thought worthy deſcription particular treatiſe pompous subject memory people rome erected triumphal arch capitol inſcription one ſide thereof ʋrbano octavo barberino pont max antiquae gloriae reſtitutori authori nova spqr veteris capitolii ruderibus hoc qualecunque recidivae ſatisfaction length ſollicited much duke parma intereſs themſelves quarrel various debate reſolved general conſent intreat pope would yield inſtances common ſatisfaction prince unanimous deſires interpoſed themſelves peace giving time expedient treaty duke gave counſel moderation humble himſelf ſuch decent ſort pope might pacifie bring honourably engagement enterpriſe mean time barberins might prevent importunity prince haſtned march towards caſtro upon opinion taken place fervour mediator interpoſed peace would abated matter reduced ſuch intricacy end glory counſels merit enterpriſe libertas à neceſſitate ſed ſufficit libertas à coactione haereticam declaramus uti talem damnamus quartam semipelagiani admittebant praevenientis gratiae interioris neceſſitatem ad ſingulos actus etiam ad initium fidei hoc erant haeretici quod vellent eam gratiam talem eſſe cui poſſet humana voluntas reſiſtere vel obtemperare falſam haereticam declaramus uti talem damnamus quintam semipelagianum eſt dicere chriſtum pro omnibus omnino mortuum eſſe aut ſanguinem fudiſſe falſam temerariam ſcandaloſam intellectam eo ſenſu ut chriſtus pro ſalute duntaxat praedeſtinatorum mortuus ſit ſoon uncle ʋrban viii interpoſition one ſingle pope would action without example unknown former age length cardinal weary three month impriſonment reſolved come concluſion rather becauſe people would effectually mazarine gave aſſent approbation difficulty overcome chigi common vote whole conclave elected 7th april 1655 ſo unanimous one diſſenting voice found scrutiny ſeldom happens roſetti himſelf ſwore would cut hand ſhould contribute ghigis election gave vote alſo end fabius chigi born siena year 1599 father flavio ghigi mother laura marſilia patrician family misfortune world accident much declined antient ſplendour father dying young education committed mother took care inſtructed beſt maſters grammar philoſophy divinity ſtudies civil law arrived age eighteen year brother auguſtine perſuaded try fortune rome commonly place raiſes men part induſtry higheſt preferment eſtate indeed low mean patrimony father divided amongſt numerous iſſue brother siſters wherefore help fortune great liking faculty poeſie particularly admirer horace imitation compoſed many ode extreamly delightful ʋrban himſelf excellent poet youthful day wrote many poem much elegancy theſe mean chigi became vandorme well pleaſed choiſe fine party agreeing cardinal haſtned chappel barbarino azzolino procured thirty one vote roſpiglioſi chigi party came concurred reſt ſo ſixty four cardinal conclave roſpiglioſi elected created pope ſixty one thus eighteen day conclave continued roſpiglioſi twentieth june proclaimed pope cardinal eſte theſe word according uſual form annuncio vobis gaudium magnum habemus eminentiſſimum reverendiſſimum dominum cardinalem julium roſpiglioſum summum pontificem qui vocatur clemens nonus uſual adoration followed performed cardinal pope habited pontifical veſtments pronounced loud voice theſe following word accuſtomed manner annuncio vobis gaudium magnum habemus pontificem eminentiſſimum reverendiſſimum dominum cardinalem benedictum odeſcalcum qui ſibi nomen ſupercilious countenance benedictus odeſcalchi born como city dukedom milan year lord 1611 hi father called livio mother paula caſtella noble patrician family como revenue thirty thouſand crown year belonging houſe odeſcalchi youth educated jeſuits inſtructed grammar humane learning aftewards ſtudied civil canon law partly rome partly naples though never eſteemed polemical divine yet reputation one knew world well practiſed nature mankind art government time ʋrban viii made one prothonotaries apoſtolical chamber afterwards created preſident ſame alſo made chief commiſſary gathering tax duty ariſing province marchio laid people time war italy buſineſs conſtituted governour macerata province thereunto adjoyning innocent x made one clark chamber long year 1645 aſſumed college cardinal deaconry beſtowed saint coſma damianus afterwards tranſlated order prieſts title conferred st onuphrius ſame innocent ſent ferrara title legat office acquitted himſelf great honour made biſhop novareſe reſided ſome year afterwards removed thence deſire reaſon heavineſs air place well agree conſtitution body rome employed many affair church called ſerve diverſe congregation cardinal occaſion indulgence may uſeful people doth anathematize ſuch ſhall deny power church grant yet deſirous doctrine thereof rightly underſtood moderation uſed granting leſt great facility eaſineſs diſcipline church corrupted enfeebled doctrine indulgence hath prickly contentious point original cauſe preſent diviſions ſeparations amongſt chriſtians thence luther began quarrel took firſt riſe ground indulgence never uſe nation eaſtern church either primitive time afterwards indeed neither practice weſtern church time ancient date time ʋrban ii year chriſt 1095 alſo common granted onely remit rigour ſeverity penance enjoined confeſſour reaſons pope innocent xi wiſely conſidering many abuſes doctrine attempt mean regulate extravagance thereof beſides ſuppreſſion theſe indulgence pope condemned ſixty five propoſitions caſes morality ſcandalous diver maintained ſubtle diſtinctions jeſuits preamble condemnation ſaith preſent innocent xi purſuance ſame work commenced predeceſſour doctrine morality tending debauchery manner encouragement looſe diſſolute life mankind nothing hath vertue piety care pope conſpicuous thoſe large aſſiſtances contribution made emperour whereby enable carry forward war againſt turk formidable enemy chriſtendom onely furniſh great ſums money diver time invited inſtantly exhorted king poland undertake heroick act whereby city vienna delivered auſtria
